context.0:
A: It seemed like a normal day.
B: In fact, it pretty much was the most normal of a day that it could had been.
C: I was out and about on my day off, when by complete chance I got a craving for a candy bar.
D: I decided that I deserved a treat and so I went to my local grocery store.
E: Since I was there, I got a couple more necessities so I wouldn't have to go later on in the week.
F: It was then, in the flour aisle, where I ran into her.
G: She seemed an ordinary older woman, no different than an average elderly person.
H: However, she looked strikingly similar to my mother.
I: It wasn't actually my mom (obviously) but she looked similar enough where I had to go talk to her.
J: She was a very interesting woman, and surprisingly, she wasn't taken aback by anything I said.
K: I told her that I thought she might be related to me.
L: I told her my own name, my mother's name, and even some extended family's names.
M: But she said that she had never heard of any of them.
N: I apologized profusely for my mistake, but she wasn't upset at all.
O: We decided to grab a donut and a coffee and chat.
P: It turned out that we actually had quite a bit in common.
Q: I will never forget the day that I met that woman.
context.1:
A: I am a professional photographer and recently reached a big milestone as a photographer.
B: I had my first portrait published in a magazine.
C: This was very exciting and made me very happy! I had been trying for a little while to get a portrait published and when it finally happened I couldn't have been more excited! The portrait that was published was a portrait of my child, which made it even more special.
D: I was so excited when I found out I just kept thanking God, and cried tears of joy! I messaged my husband to tell him the news! He was so excited and happy for me and was very supportive.
E: I also messaged some family members and they were also very happy to hear the news.
F: Everyone was very happy about the news and that was great! I ordered a copy of the magazine and couldn't wait for it to come in.
G: When it came in I was brimming with excitement! I was overjoyed when I opened the magazine and saw my portrait! I couldn't believe how great it looked! I showed it to my child and they were also very excited to see their portrait in the magazine.
H: This was such an exciting time and great milestone as a photographer.
context.2:
A: After years of saving and waiting I was finally ready to buy my first home.
B: This was a long and sometimes painful process but a good experience nonetheless.
C: I viewed tons of homes and could not find the one for me.
D: I searched and searched and just couldn't find that one that stood out from the rest.
E: Finally, after what felt like an eternity of searching I was ready to give up.
F: I was exhausted from searching and just didn't want to do it anymore.
G: The last house on my viewing list was the one! It was perfect for me.
H: I ended up putting an offer in on the house and the sellers accepted.
I: There were a few things that needed to be done and a few things that needed updating but the house was exactly what I was looking for.
J: This experience taught me to never give up.
K: I couldn't have been happier.
L: It was a long time coming.
M: Finally, my house hunting journey was over.
N: I have been living in this home ever since and I love it.
context.3:
A: It was a sunny Alaskan day in the brooks range.
B:  I saddled up 12 dogs and headed out on a training run.
C:  My training runs with the dogs were between 5-10 miles because that’s what I typically took the guests on.
D:  The sun was so bright the snow was a perfect texture for the dogs to get some speed.
E:  We took off fast and ran Ahead of pace majority of the run.
F:  I decided to take A break at one of my favorite spots where the trail meets the river.
G:  As I looked out to my amazement I saw a baby moose struggling through the snow.
H:  A minute later I spotted the mom moose not far behind.
I:  I sat very calm and still so the dogs didn’t get alarmed.
J: Next, I heard a strange sound I hadn’t heard before.
K:  As I looked out I saw something trotting through the woods, not far from the moose.
L:  To my surprise it was a lynx.
M:  Lynx are a pretty rare sight as they are very sneaky.
N:  I noticed another lynx not far behind the first one, it was an amazing sight.
O:  Before the dogs noticed I gave the call and we took off.
P:  We continued the rest of the trail fast with a smile.
context.4:
A: Since last writing about this event, it has continued to progress and develop.
B: My son is now much more mobile and active than he was when I last wrote about this.
C: He is walking around (while holding onto things) and climbing all over everything.
D: He is opening cabinets and drawers and taking things out to play with them.
E: He is quite a handful now.
F: His personality is even more apparent and he is able to process and display more complex thoughts and emotions.
G: We are much more social with each other now.
H: talking and playing have a lot more significance now.
I: He has grown so much in the last few months.
J: It is clear that at this stage, his growth is faster than it has ever been.
K: I assume that his growth will continue to accelerate until we can't even keep up with him anymore.
L: Enough time has passed that I am beginning to miss when he was smaller because of the simplicity we had in our lives, but I love watching him learn and grow up.
M: I look forward to seeing him start to walk on his own.
N: I am also excited for his first word.
O: It will be great when we can communicate meaningfully with each other.
P: I also am looking forward to when he can hold a bottle up all by himself.
context.5:

B: She asked me was I going to let her see the kids.
C: Of course when i said no I was made out to be the bad guy again.
D:  Everybody keeps saying she changed I should not hold my childhood against her.
E: But shouldn't I? When I was finally ready to give her a chance that went all the way left.
F: I asked her how did I get burned why do i have what looks like cigarette marks on my body ? And her response was God has already forgiven me for what I have done.
G: I remember being so taken a back by what she said I didn't even know how to answer.
H: How could she deny me the information because God forgave her.
I: I wanted to scream What about me the person who all this crap happened too? But I didn't I just didn't say anything.
J: Its easy for people to say you should forgive when they are not the ones who have been wrong.
K: I have children of my own and I know sometimes parenting is Hard.
L: But I have never wanted to hurt my kids.
M: And when i make a mistake I come back and i say im sorry.
N: Why couldnt she have least done that? So no she will never be in my life and that includes my kids life and m fine with that,
context.6:
A: I was on my daily game of Dota 2 last week and I had a very intense two hour game that is both stressful yet rewarding.
B: It's always been stressful yet rewarding for me over the thousands of hours I have played in this game but my last week's game stands out than the rest.
C: I picked Crystal Maiden as my hero and I went with another person who played a carry Slark at the bottom lane.
D: My lane partner was very vocal on the team chat on how I am very inefficient and was stealing his experience points in the game.
E: He did say something about how "noob" I am and grew more and more frustrated minute by minute.
F: He was killed multiple times in the early game and of course, I was blamed for it.
G: I did not let his words be a distraction nor a way to just give up and surrender.
H: Even though I had a mic, I stayed quiet and just typed "I'm sorry" on chat whenever he screamed at me.
I: Our towers are down but I kept optimistic on winning.
J: Even though he was being angry at me and whenever I made I mistake I get bullied by him, he also never gave up and continued gaining experience and gold necessary for his hero to be powerful.
K: The first time the enemy made a mistake and we won a team fight, I immediately congratulated our team for the great play and my other teammates were all audibly optimistic as well.
L: Our carry Slark at this point has considerably limited his verbal abuse and I was sure that he will cooperate once he realized we were all there to win the game.
M: The enemy had many more mistakes after that and we had a very satisfying comeback.
N: I would always commend and rate positively my teammates whenever I win, so I did it as well with Slark.
O: I was surprised that he did commend me back and got a friend request from him after the game.
P: I did accept his friend requests and we've been playing a few more games to this day.
Q: I actually quite like his company and we enjoy our in-game banter and he actually jokes a lot with me now.
context.7:
A: A little over 3 months ago I discovered that I was unexpectedly pregnant.
B: I have a son who just turned 12, and since I'm in my 30's I figured I was done.
C: I am also a very independent woman, with a good career and almost done with my MBA.
D: So the timing is a little hectic.
E: I always had planned on having another after my son, but when it didn't happen in a few years I started to make other plans.
F: I have been a single mother for years and felt no need to settle, so I was planning on adopting in the next few years.
G: I've also worked very hard on my fitness the past 2 years, and this plan felt perfect so I wouldn't have to give up the progress on my body.
H: About 6 months ago I started dating a coworker, who is a great man.
I: I'd even told him not to expect me to have kids if he wanted to be with me.
J: Then after just 2 months I found out I was pregnant.
K: At first it was a huge shock, and honestly I wasn't very happy.
L: After some months to get used to it, I can honestly say I'm very excited now though.
M: It's been a huge adjustment, however.
N: I went from living alone to having my boyfriend move in to help with my bills.
O: Being an only child, my personal space is very important to me.
P: I understand some sacrifices are necessary though, and in the end it will definitely be worth it.
context.8:
A: today we took our son to college.
B: It was a very sad day.
C: we helped him arrange his apartment.
D: we took him to the store to get stocked up on groceries.
E: we came back and visited for a while.
F: that afternoon we decided it was time for us to head back home.
G: i did not want to go.

I: this is good for him though.
J: good for me, too.
K: i am so very proud of him.
L: he is going to be fine.

N: he is my first born.
O: it is going to take me a while to recover, especially when i go into his room.
P: it will be good to hear his voice when he calls.

R: i will probably call him tonight!

context.10:
A: My husband and I have had a beautiful marriage! Our love, bond, and loyalty has only grown with every year of new adventures and exciting times.
B: We have had ups and downs, high and lows, ebbs and flows.
C: The good times have made our love deepen and the hard times have only made us stronger.
D: We have two beautiful children that have completed our family and our lives.
E: We have supported each other through jobs, stresses, monumental events, family deaths, etc.
F: We were proud of our journey and relationship and wanted to celebrate the enormous milestone of ten years of a healthy and happy marriage.
G: We decided to renew our vows in front of family and friends.
H: We wanted it to be a joyous occasion marked by love, fun, dancing, food, and great memories.
I: We invited friends and family from all over the country to join us for dinner and dancing.
J: It was a lovely weekend that everyone is still talking about! I wore a gorgeous dress and my husband looked handsome in his tuxedo.
K: Our children attended and got to share in the love of our marriage.
L: We made amazing memories that we will never forget.
M: Most importantly, we remembered how and why we have lasted ten years and made a promise to last another ten and beyond.
context.11:
A: I recently had surgery for my knee injury.
B: Surgery went well, but the doctor found the injury was worse than expected.
C: I had to have addition repairs done to my knee.
D: It also turns out the recovery is way longer than expected.
E: I was told by the doctor I would be walking again a few days after the procedure.
F: However, that wasn't true.
G: It turns out that this will be a 3-6 months recovery process.
H: Right now now I am going on about 2 months.
I: I still can't fully bend my knee back past 90 degrees.
J: And I still experience a lot of pain.
K: The pain usually hurts the most at night and keeps me up sometimes.
L: I am required to wear a knee brace all the time.
M: But the brace is pretty uncomfortable and itchy so I take a break every chance I get.
N: All in all right now this wasn't looking like the best idea.
O: But I guess that's just the process of going through recovery.
P: I am in physical therapy two time a week, and it does help.
Q: So hopefully after therapy is completed I will be better off.
context.12:
A: I finished a book I have been reading for the last few days.
B:  It was a western which is outside of my normal book choices.
C:  It was titled "Lonesome Dove" and was written by Larry McMurtry.
D:   "Lonesome Dove" is the name of a near ghost town in south Texas.
E:  The two main characters are Gus and McCall.
F:  They are aging ex-Texas Rangers that decide to go on one last adventure.
G:  They decide to steal some cattle from Mexico and start a ranch in the northern U.S.
H:  I think it as Montana.
I:  The book had very rich character development.
J:  There were good guys, bad guys, and in-between guys.
K:  On of the major villains is the a really bad guy name "Blue Duck".
L:  One of the in-between is a girl/woman named Lori.
M:  She is a "lady of the night" but sweet just the same.
N:  Gus and McCall are kind of the good guys.
O:  The scenery and imagery are very rich.
P:  It is very colorful in terms of the language.
Q:  You need to remember this book and maybe get other books written by McMurtry.
R:  I really miss this book -- it seemed like an old friend.
context.13:
A: It was our first trip to Colorado since I was a very young child and the first overall with my new family.
B: My wife and daughter had never been to the Rocky Mountains either, so it was sure to be a treat.
C: We stayed with my wife's cousin and were there primarily to visit my wife's aunt.
D: She has very sick and moved from Chicago to Boulder in order to live a more comfortable life.
E: The first full day were were in Colorado we were taken to the Rocky Mountain National Park.
F: Unlike the typical park in a city setting, this was a huge, and I mean huge area, covering a vast majority of the Rocky Mountain range.
G: My wife's aunt was able to come with, using her scooter, so it was nice spending our day with her also.
H: She had only been to the lower portion of the park, so we were determined to get her to the top-most visitor's center in the park.
I: After an hour and a half or so, we finally made it.
J: We were able to buy some souvenirs and eat a nice lunch with my wife's cousin and aunt.
K: It was a great lunch, and was the closest I had been to nature in a long, long time.
L: After the long drive back, my wife, daughter, and I went white water rafting! None of us had done anything like that before, so it was quite exciting.
M: My daughter and I sat in the front of the raft, with my wife sitting behind my daughter.
N: No sooner had we left the shore, my wife fell in! She was "rescued" but soured for the rest of the ride.
O: We kept her spirits up and we powered through nice category IV and category V rapids! She made it the rest of the way and although she was a trooper after having fallen in, she vowed never, ever, to do anything even close to resembling that again.
P: After we finished, we were bused back to our start point, drove back to my wife's cousin's house and went to bed after a very long, exhausting, yet fulfilling day.
context.14:
A: Dear Diary,Well, the day has come.
B: I didn't think that this would actually happen to me, but it did.
C: I was told to expect something like this occurring, but I didn't realize that it would actually occur, if that makes sense.
D: You never think this kind of thing would happen to you until it did.
E: I still don't really know how to feel.
F: I don't want to talk to anyone.
G: I don't want to go to school.
H: I don't want to go to work.
I: All I want to do is sit at home and do nothing.
J: Everyone says that life will go on, but it doesn't feel like it.
K: Feels like just yesterday when I was told I was pregnant.
L: I feel like this entire thing went by so fast.
M: From the time I found out to this miscarriage, it was only what? Three weeks, max? It feels like I just blinked and the entire event flew by.
N: I can't believe, again, that this would happen to me.
O: Now I have to face the world without the child growing in my belly.
P: How can I be around other kids? How can I deal with seeing other pregnant women? This is the toughest moment of my life.
Q: Since I found out I pregnant, I've thought about it every second of every day - I doubt that that will change.
context.15:
A: I was concerned about the number of times my mother had fallen recently.
B:  I was extremely nervous to be with her and watch her walk, and I was nervous to not be there and watch her walk.
C:  She fell when she was less than a foot away from me.
D:  It happened so quickly, that I had no chance to help her or slow her fall.
E:  I realized at that time that it didn't matter whether I was there or not, she was deteriorating and she would fall again.
F:  I knew that at some point, she would break a bone.
G: That is exactly what happened.
H:  She broke a bone in her wrist when  I wasn't there.
I:  I was actually quite relieved when the hospital suggested rehab.
J:  I hoped it would help strengthen her.
K:  I also hoped that the rehab center would be able to convince her to use her walker, as I had been unable to do.
L: She worked hard at rehab and was getting stronger.
M:  She was never strong enough to go home, and she passed quietly in her sleep.
N:  I had hoped that she would be able to come home again.
O:  He had worked hard to keep everything just the way she liked things at her house.
context.16:
A: About two years ago I decided to marry my girlfriend after dating for quite a long time.
B:  I wanted to get her a nice ring so I contacted her cousin to find out what type of ring would suit her.
C: She came back with some ideas and I went from there.
D:    I ordered the ring offline and had to wait for it to be shipped and signed for.
E:  Well that day fedex was in my driveway as I got home.
F:  The very same day I was to propose to her!  I think I got very lucky.
G:  The night I proposed I was very nervous and was not able to eat my food much at all which people at our table thought that in itself was very strange.
H:  It was on her birthday and we decided to go to the resturant where we went on our first date at.
I:  We invited my parents, our son was there, and her family.
J:  We had a good time and I finally pulled out the ring to put it on my pinky so it was ready.
K:  My dad was getting anxious and was ready to leave until I showed him the ring under the table.
L:  He was then relaxed and thought I should get on with it.
M:  So, I just simply asked, didnt get down on one knee or anything, but offered it to her and myself.
N:  She said yes!  We were married later the next year and are very happy now.
context.17:
A: Three months ago I discovered that I'm pregnant.
B: It's really hard to believe.
C: There was a time in my life when I didn't think I would ever want to have kids.
D: I mean, they're just so sticky and smelly and...they just seem like work.
E: But the more I think about it, the more I realize that this might be a gift.
F: Maybe I'm ready for my life to mean something more than...to be about something more than just me, just getting through, just going from one moment to the next.
G: I keep thinking about the future.
H: What it looks like, what's going to happen after I'm gone.
I: I never really thought much about it before, never really thought about the past either for that matter.
J: And now, all of a sudden, it's like time has just opened up before me.
K: I think about the baby inside me.
L: Who are they going to be? Where are they going to end up? How will they change the world.
M: I keep think too about the past, all the people before me who were once children, were once babies growing inside someone's stomach.
N: It makes me dizzy, like looking up at the stars from the top of the mountain--how they just keep going and going.
O: It scares me too, makes me afraid for this little life I'm going to bring into the world.
P: How can I keep them safe? But I'm excited, I'm determined, to make the most of this gift.
context.18:
A: When I graduated with my credential and master's degree it was June.
B: I was hopeful to find a job for the 2019-2020 school year.
C: However, there were not very many teaching jobs available during this time period.
D: This was true for all subjects.
E: This meant that I only had one job interview during that time.
F: Unfortunately, I was the runner up for that position.
G: It was because I did not have experience.
H: While I continue to look for a job, I am substitute teaching.
I: This is not as good of a job due to financial concerns.
J: It also sucks to not have my own classroom.
K: You are not able to establish the same types of relationships with students that you can in your own classroom.
L: It was surprising to me how bad the job market has been considering the news is constantly saying that there is a teacher shortage.
M: Now I am stuck with student loans to pay.
N: My substitute teaching job is not enough to cover these loans.
O: I think that they should be more honest with the state of the teacher job market.
context.19:
A: Today was like any other day, I was happy and in love.
B: When I say this came out of nowhere I really mean it.
C: I woke up and did my morning ritual.
D: I made coffee and breakfast for myself and my girlfriend.
E: We normally survive on coffee and something simple to eat.
F: I cooked our favorite which we, I, call egg in a hole.
G: As soon as my girlfriend, or should I say ex-girlfriend by now, entered the kitchen, something felt off.
H: I looked at her face and got a tinge of fear.
I: She looked so serious when she's normally so bubbly.
J: From that moment, all time slowed down but yet everything felt like a blur.
K: First she said she needed to talk to me.
L: I panicked and she must have saw it because she tried to calm me.
M: She said that had found someone else and was no longer in love with me.
N: My heart sank.
O: It came out of nowhere, or I missed all the signs.
P: I begged and pleaded with her not to leave me.
Q: I might have made a fool of myself, I cringe when I think of it.
R: I was crushed and began to cry.
S: She left after eating.
T: I couldn't eat and just went to my bed.
U: I drifted in and out of sleep because when I slept it didn't hurt.
context.20:
A: Me and my husband woke up one day to an email on his phone that had said "You have been working hard this past week, I will give you a slight raise on your paycheck." It was his boss.
B: When we looked at how much money we had, we had a lot of extra money.
C: We both thought that this was intentional so we decided that the next day we will plan a surprise trip to Las Vegas.
D: We were only going to spend two days there, though I wished it could have been longer.
E: The next day we got there and we checked in to our room at a really nice hotel.
F: We placed our bags down and went off to the strip to go explore.
G: We went into a lot of hotels and gambled for hours.
H: Later that night we tried to gamble more but I could not find any of our money.
I: We had spent it all on gambling all day.
J: We just went back to the room and decided to go to sleep.
K: When we woke up I had remembered I left some extra money in the bags.
L: It was only twenty dollars but it was enough for some good breakfast.
M: After breakfast we had five dollars to spare so we decided to just put it in a slot machine.
N: We thought all hope was gone when we put that money in that we were expecting to lose.
O: But just then we saw all the pictures lining up and we won over a thousand dollars.
P: We were very exited and went to cash it in.
Q: We stayed an extra night and got some gourmet food for breakfast lunch and dinner!
context.21:
A: What a day! About three months ago something amazing happened to me.
B: I bought my first home! The process was a long and drawn out one but so worth it in the end.
C: I looked at house after house after house and finally settled on the perfect one for me.
D: I started the process months before I actually purchased.
E: It took a long time finding a home because I am so indecisive and I didn't want to make a mistake and buy something I would hate in the future.
F: This caused me to want to see any and everything that was available.
G: Even after I thought I had seen it as I contemplated which house to purchase I couldn't decide.
H: I received a phone call from my realtor a few days after all the showings available to me were over and she communicated to me that there was one brand new listing that we had not seen.
I: This turned out to be the one.
J: It was everything I wanted and dreamed of when I first started the process of buying a home.
K: I was in love with the house and put in an offer immediately.
L: My offer was accepted and sometime later I moved in and have been loving life ever since.
M: I don't want to live anywhere else.
N: Although this was a daunting task, I wouldn't change how it all played out.
context.22:
A: Dear Diary, today I've been doing a lot of thinking about my cousin's wedding.
B: It was such a beautiful day, and I was & still am so happy that she found her person.
C: But I can't help but feel a bit of residual stress as I think over how I almost ruined it for her.
D: Maybe that's dramatic, but I felt like I was ruining things when I spilled my champagne down the front of my bridesmaid's gown when she was counting on me to just show up and be presentable.
E: Of course,  she wasn't mad at me in the end (maybe that's because we got it cleaned up), but the stress and embarrassment I felt was crazy.
F: I haven't been to many big events like that lately, and I was freaking out.
G: As if standing up in front of all those people wasn't enough pressure.
H: Now, I thought, I'd have to either do it with a giant wet stain down my front, or change and be the only person in the wedding party wearing old, ripped jeans.
I: I even thought, for a moment, about just sitting the whole thing out.
J: But of course, that would've also ruined it because of how we'd rehearsed everything and I had to walk with a groomsman.
K: Luckily, our wonderful grandma made it to the wedding that day.
L: Leave it to an old-timer to know all the secret tricks for getting stains out.
M: It took her no time at all to make my dress good as new, and the weight just instantly lifted off my chest.
N: I know it's probably not as big of a deal as I make it out to be, but I've always been prone to anxiety.
O: My cousin is so important to me and I just couldn't stand the thought of ruining her big day.
P: She's waited so long for it.
Q: Thankfully, it all went according to plan and she's got perfect, champagne-stain-free photos to look back on and remember forever.
R: I'm so happy it all worked out in the end.
context.23:
A: In April my husband and I drove from Tennessee to Miami to celebrate my older sister's birthday and to see our niece and family.
B: It was a long drive and we stopped some place about 2 hours away for the night.
C: We arrived right at lunchtime, but my sister and husband hadn't gotten there yet.
D: They were coming from just across the state.
E: So we had a little time to visit with my niece who I'll call N.
F: We also got to meet her staff who works out of N's home.
G: Once my sister (C) arrived we started to have lunch, but not before N took her mother's sandwich and hid it.

context.25:
A: Life happens so quickly that sometimes you don't realize how much of it has passed.
B: You just wake up each day and go through the same routine as though you're on auto pilot.
C: You wake the kids, walk the dog and go to work then the next thing you know the work day is over then it's back home to get ready for bed and start the cycle all over again.
D: Days turn into weeks and weeks into months and you wonder where the time went while waiting to reach this destination of happiness you've been longing to find for as long as you can remember.
E: Recently, in one of those brief moments of wonder and longing I did more than reminisce over time and it's elusive passing.
F: I decided that I was tired of the same thing every day and tired of the waiting for something more when it's not possible to know how much time you have left.
G: I keep waiting for this happiness like it's a destination when I had to remind myself that being happy is a mood.
H: Sometimes it's brief and sometimes it's replaced by sadness, bitterness, or anger.
I: I reminded myself it was time to actually live my life and that meant having more of these happy moments so I decided to get off of auto pilot and truly live.
J: I had been at the same job for almost 7 1/2 years and it has been a great place to work, but felt stuck in a job I just had to go to because I felt it was my only option.
K: I had found  extra work in an online platform and it was nice to have extra income in times when I needed it.
L: I started to think about my job and how I had to miss out on things with my kids because of work and I decided to just quit.
M: Out of the blue, I just quit my job after 7 1/2 years and decided I was going to support myself and my children by committing to work full time online so I would be a single stay at home mom.
N: After I actually done this I felt empowered but by the next day I felt terrified because I had devoted 7 1/2 years to a job I had planned to retire from.
O: I questioned myself and then realized, this chapter was officially over.
P: I had taken the kids to school and it was time for me to get online and work.
Q: This was almost 3 weeks ago.
R: It has been a struggle so far and I'm learning how to navigate my time when it comes to working online, but it's been rewarding.
S: This destination of happiness, while I realized it's a mood and not so much a destination, I have spent much more time feeling it.
T: I've not only been able to take my kids to school, but I've actually been able to watch my 14 year old son's soccer games and haven't missed a baseball practice for my younger son and we've spent more time hiking and going to the dog park.
U: I know it won't be easy but I am tired of living on auto pilot.
V: For the first time in as long as I can even remember I'm happy and that's an incredible feeling.
W: I hope to find more work online because I need more income soon, but I feel as though things will work out for the best.
X: Sometimes you have to choose yourself and actually live.
Y: This was my time and I'm proud to say I chose me.
context.26:
A: My story is about a family reunion in June of this year.
B: My dad turned 90 on July 4th and he is the last  person alive on his side of the family.
C: My grandparents came here when they were nineteen from Europe around 1911.
D: They had three boys and one girl .
E: I  have one whole sister and one half sister.
F:  My dad and mom got divorced when I was sixteen.
G: He remarried a girl much younger that was my babysitter and they had one girl.
H: After he married her , she stopped inviting me and my sister over   and my dad would call occasionally and say come over, but when you weren't invited over for the past few years, you don't feel that invite is sincere and I didn't go.
I: So I am not close with my half sister and we barely speak when we see each other out.
J: My cousins parents from my dad's siblings never got divorced.
K: So my cousins wanted to come in for my dad's 90th and they brought all kinds of food and pictures and we had a good time .
L: Lots of pictures were taken and everything was great.
M: I just felt that my life and relationship with my dad was very different than my cousins and they don't understand what it is like when parents get divorced and how kids can be treated because of it.
N: I feel cheated in that respect and felt envious that they had normal childhoods and good relationships with their parents.
O: I still talk to my dad when I see him in the local grocery store but it is just casual talk and that is kind of sad.
P:  He is not going to be around much longer and I wish things had been different between us but I don't think it was all my fault .
Q: I think that will probably be our last family reunion .
R: I am glad I got to see everyone and we had a great time.
S: But it is also sad that it probably won't happen again .
T: Not much you can do but accept things as they are and not dwell on them.

A: It was about a month ago during a rather warm July morning.

E: As I watered the cacti by the chain link fence I noticed a humming bird.
F: At first I thought he was just doing his early morning pollen rituals, but to my surprise he wanted water.
G: The thing is he did not want water to drink he wanted to get wet by the mist of the garden hose.
H: I turned down the pressure of the hose to a fine mist and pointed the mist into the direction of the humming bird .
I: The bird loved it he stayed stationary in the water stream for a long time.
J: If I moved the hose a little he would follow to stay in the stream.
K: It was great the bird had no fear of animosity of a human.
L: He knew there was a human controlling the hose and he did not care he wanted water on this warm summer day.
M: I felt great, I felt a connection with this little bird, we at this brief aquatic encounter were friends.
N: It seemed that God saw my loneliness and sent me a friend.
O: That small communal moment with nature make me feel better for the rest of the day.
P: I started to realize that day can friends come in all shapes and sizes.

A: A couple months ago during summer I was playing basketball in a tournament.
B: We were doing pretty well in the tournament and had already won several game.
C: On me time I had my 2 brothers and one of my cousins playing.
D: We were all having fun and enjoying ourselves.
E: I remember it was like the 3rd or 4th game when something bad happened.
F: The other team missed a shot and someone on my team got the rebound.
G: I started running towards my basket and my teammate threw me the ball.
H: I caught it and took a couple dribbles.
I: Shortly after I caught the ball I noticed someone on the opposite team running towards me.
J: The player was a little taller than me so I knew I had to adjust my shot a bit.
K: I went up for a lay up with my right hand to fake my opponent, then tried to finish with my left.
L: During the shot I had to adjust my body in a weird angle in the air so that I wouldn't get my shot blocked.
M: Because of this I came down really hard on my right knee.
N: I don't know if it was the angle I landed on or what but I felt a huge strain in my knee as soon as I landed.
O: I sat at the rest of the game and had to walk with a limp for the rest of the day.
P: I later on went to the doctor to check it out and found out I ruptured a ligament in my knee.
Q: I had to get surgery to repair it and couldn't walk again for a couple of weeks.

context.47:
A: It was a warm winter day in the interior of Alaska with the sun shining brighter than  it has in months.
B:  I harnessed up 11 out of the 12 dogs i had to the sled and hit the trail.
C:  The trail was extremely fast considering the sun was melting the hard packed snow and freezing it over night.
D:  We took off on our normal training run and the dogs were extremely focused.
E:  I had my go-pro rolling since the day was so beautiful and i wanted to capture the openness of crossing the river on such a bright day.
F:  We ran without a break until we got to the river and i could tell the dogs were getting tired.
G:  We took a break right before the downhill to cross the river and when i looked up i noticed a moose just across the bank.
H:  The dogs were so tired they didn't even notice, the more i watched this big cow moose eat off the trees i noticed a calf emerge from the woods behind her.
I:  I watched in amazement as i always did when i saw moose, now was my chance to be quiet and watch because they hadn't seen me yet.
J:  While i was watching the moose i heard a scream not too far off which sounded like a cat, and indeed it was.
K:  Only 45-50 yards away from the moose was a full grown lynx walking the bank of the river.
L:  Lynx are extremely rare to see in the wild and i was excited.
M:  I couldn't believe that the dogs had not made a sound at this point, but they typically didn't during a needed rest.
N:  Just when i thought this free nature show couldn't get any better a second lynx walked out from the woods and began a mating call with the first lynx.
O:  I listened to them and watched them walk the bank for what seemed like and hour.
P:  I have never seen anything so great and beautiful from nature and probably never will.
Q:  Soon as the lynx and moose were out of my site i commanded the dogs to hit the trail and continue the run.

context.48:
A: When Auntie was diagnosed with cancer for the fourth time, it was rough, but we thought she'd beat it.
B: We went over to visit her often during treatments, went to the hospital when she was checked in for the initial treatments, and generally kept up a lot of support.
C: Me and Kiddo thought it was important for her to know we were there for her.
D: She seemed to be handling treatment well.
E: Then, out of the blue, she had a massive stroke which reduced her to still alive, not needing life support, but also not able to really communicate.
F: We had no way of knowing what she did or did not process, understand, feel, etc.
G: So we acted on the DNR she had signed before and provided nothing but water.
H: It was so difficult to see her there in that state, basically slowly dying and fading away.
I: As (then) executor of her trust I began to gather everything I needed to make sure this went smoothly for my cousin (her beneficiary).
J: It was hard to post her final goodbye to friends on FB after she passed, but I did what she asked.
K: Then I discovered: she had not fully finished setting up the trust and I had very limited resources.
L: Much to my surprise, I was completely unable to do everything she asked, and had to resign as executor and hand it back over to my young cousin and be there for him for support.
M: I did what I could to give him all the info he needed and put him in touch with the trust attorney.
N: Sadly, and surprisingly too, since I last wrote about this he has not done well.
O: He still needs help accessing all of the resources she left him and after his power was shut off reached out for help.
P: The surprises just don't end with this event, they just keep coming and coming and I pray they will settle down soon.

context.65:
A: I was experiencing lots of eye strain and headaches and decided to go to the optometrist to get my eyes checked out.
B: I thought that maybe the prescription had changed in my glasses and this was causing my headaches.
C: I told the nurse at the office about my headaches and she ran all of the regular tests and checked for glaucoma.
D: My eyes were healthy and they didn't find anything that should be causing the headaches.
E: As soon as the doctor came in to see me, he took one look at my misaligned eyes and told me that I could have surgery to get my eyes lined up properly.
F: He spent the rest of the time giving me information about the surgery and then asked if I was interested.
G: I told him that I was and his office referred me to an eye surgeon the next day.
H: I visited the eye surgeon, and she told me that because of my severe eye turn, she wouldn't be able to completely line my eyes up, but that she could get them close enough that an ordinary person could not tell that they were turned in some.
I: She was afraid that I would see double the rest of my life if she completely aligned them.
J: Long story short, I went ahead and scheduled the eye surgery.
K: After hearing about all the risks involved, I had some trepidation.
L: The surgery went very well and the thing that surprised me the most when I woke up was that I was not seeing double at all.
M: My vision was a little cloudy and I was groggy, but, my field of vision was so much broader.
N: I looked into the mirror and saw that my eyes were truly aligned! This was wonderful news! Recovery went well.
O: I basically rested and didn't do much of anything while my husband took care of the house and our girls.
P: The only side effect of the surgery was sore eyes for a few weeks, but my vision kept improving as time went by.
Q: I am so happy that I made the decision to get my eyes fixed.
R: It has really changed my life in so many ways.

context.68:
A: In May I signed up to volunteer at a garden giveaway in my town.
B: It's a program that provides plants, seeds, dirt and containers with dirt for portable gardens for low income people.
C: The lady that runs it was a friend and co-worker of mine, so when I decided to start volunteering I reached out to her and she said this was something she thought I'd like.
D: I really wasn't sure what to expect when I got there.
E: I had worked in a community garden before and it seemed like most of the poor people who showed up just wanted the vegetables and didn't want to really put in the work needed to maintain the garden.
F: When I showed up I was kind of skeptical about how it would go but I was ready.
G: The event was way more than I expected.
H: We had over 100 people show up.
I: They didn't seem like they were just there for a handout, they wanted to learn how to maintain and grow the gardens we were giving them.
J: They asked about watering and sunlight and took a lot of time picking the plants they wanted to grow.
K: The best part about it was the kids that came.
L: Sometimes they were more excited than the parents about starting the garden.
M: It was encouraging to see.
N: Wendy, the lady that runs the program said changing the mindset of the next generation of low income is important and I felt like we were doing that.
O: Teaching them about the importance of vegetables and how you can grow your own might actually help them be better and healthier adults.
P: It made me wish I had been better about this with my own son instead of just buying all my produce from the store.
Q: I don't really know how all these gardens we gave away turned out.
R: I'm sure maybe some people just gave up and didn't really continue and see results, but I;m sure that a lot of people did benefit from the giveaway and are enjoying the fruits of their labor today.
S: And I'm hopeful  that down the line we helped raise some future gardeners whose life will be better because of it.
T: The whole experience of volunteering at the giveaway left me with a good feeling and I plan to work the event in years to come.
U: It will be interesting to see if people return and maybe even have stories to tell or pictures of their successful gardens!

context.71:
A: Just four months ago, my daughter married her long time boyfriend.
B:  I always knew they would get married but it was still kinda surprising and emotional when they announced it.
C:  The wedding itself was just a small family affair that happened at the court house with a celebration afterwards.
D:  She wanted it like that and I was fine with it too.
E:  It was less planning and fanfare which is more her style.
F:  One of the best things about this wedding is that my son came and he and my daughter got to be reunited with each other.
G:  They've been arguing and hostile with each other for the past five years so this was kinda a big deal.
H:  I was so glad to see them finally reconcile with each other because it's been a huge strain for me having them fighting with each other.
I:  It makes it hard because neither will come to family get togethers like Christmas if they know the other is there and this makes me so sad.
J:  I want the whole family together and it's just not the same if one is not there.
K:  So this was a big deal to me and made the wedding all the more meaningful.
L:  I didn't know that my son was going to come and actually I expected him not to, so I was really surprised when he showed up.
M:  I saw him talking to my daughter later that night at our house and I expected it to get heated but to my surprise they were laughing and smiling.
N:  Turns out from what he told me later they both apologized to each other and decided life was too short to continue arguing.
O:  I am so glad and warmed in my heart that they have made up with each other.
P:  It was tearing my heart apart that they had tension with each other and now I feel so much better.
Q:  I just hope they can continue getting along and don't fall back into that horrible state again.
R:  Now I can't wait to become a grandmother.
context.72:
A: After having a career-ending stroke 2 years ago, I had to have many operations in 2018.
B: I then was placed on disability social security and suddenly found myself retired.
C: Luckily, I just lost some use of my legs and went blind in my left eye, but better than those that suffered far worse then I.
D:     Within this time, I became reacquainted with my very first kiss 48 years earlier.
E: Her name was Debbie.
F: While talking with her on New Year's Day 2019, she mentioned she was lonely, as was I.
G: She said she was very single and living with her son in Daytona Beach Florida and invited me down (I lived in a suburb of Cleveland Ohio at the time.)      I planned to visit her, as I was nearing the end of my operations, and pretty sick of Northern winter weather.
H: So, I visited this woman I had not seen in 48 years in April of this year.
I: I was shocked that she wanted to see me the entire time I was there, but dismayed I didn't get our second kiss.
J: I found and find her very attractive still.
K:     When I got back up north, I still played in my mind the idea of moving down to Daytona Beach.
L: My life as I knew it, was over in Ohio.
M: No job, no children, friends were far gone.
N: Thus, I took a big chance and decided to move down.
O:     I found a home in June of 2019, that sounded great! It was furnished and the cost was affordable, thus I decided on it, and began to throw away all my furniture and everthing else from my long past.
P:     When I finally moved down in late July of 2019, I got here and found that I was a victim of an internet scam by the woman selling me a place to live.
Q: There was no house.
R: I had to live in a Motel 6 and an Airbnb until I could borrow money from my sister to find a home.
S: The move itself now cost me $2000 and I have no furniture, forks, knives, dishes, pots, pans.....well I had nothing to put into it.
T:     And it took me until the 3rd week of August to move in, and then I find out that a Hurricane is currently headed straight for Daytona Beach right now.
U: And the relationship with Debbie is more of a friend thing than a romantic one I was hoping for.
V: But, I plan to now make this my home and see what happens.

E: The eye doctor I visited told me that I could have surgery to have my eyes realigned.
F: He reassured me that it was a safe procedure and would greatly improve the appearance.
G: I didn't really need much time to think it over, and I immediately signed up for an appointment scheduled for three months later.
H: I could barely sit still during those three months because I was overcome with joy and anxiousness.
I: Despite not being able to see on the day following my surgery, I was so thrilled to finally have this procedure done.
J: And once everything finally healed it was absolutely unbelievable! The doctor did a fabulous job! My eyes look normal for the first time in my life.

G: I approached her and offered my help.
H: I told her i would drop my things off at home and come back to help her carry some things.
I: She lived nearby as well.

K: I dropped my things off at home, and came back to the store to help her carry her bags to her home.

M: She wanted to give me a cake she had made and i declined.
N: I told her we could go for coffee sometime as a thank you.

context.82:
A: What do you do when she just doesn't want to be with you anymore? There was no fight, there was no argument, she just looks you in the face, tells you she loves you and that you are an "amazing man", but she just doesn't feel right and wants to leave.
B: I have never been more confused in all my life, HOW can I be an "amazing man" and yet she wants to leave.
C: But there it was, she had been looking at places to move behind my back for months and I guess seeing someone else as well.
D: I bought my first house with this woman, adoped a dog with this woman and swore to take care of this woman (to her father) and now she wants to leave.
E: We bought the house, that house flooded two months later, I busted my butt to rebuild and make it more comfortable for HER, not me HER.
F: And now she's leaving.
G: My purpose for having a house and rebuilding it the way I did was there no longer.
H: One of the hardest things in my life.
I: So what to do? Well, I pack.
J: She didn't want to be there, she was coming to get her stuff (eventually), so I began to pack every-single-thing of hers and shove it away.
K: So I didn't have to see it.
L: Pots, pans, utensils, everything that could be taken down or moved was packed.
M: Anything that reminded me of her.
N: I repainted rooms, redecorated, tried to make what I built for her mine in a few weeks time.
O: I spent time outside and built a patio, I built furniture that would replace the ones that I bought for her.
P: When her dad and uncle came to help her pack they had tears in their eyes, I guess they loved me too (or knew how much pain I was in).
Q: They didn't know why I did most of the hard work for them, it was because they were great men and I wanted them to be my family, hell, sometimes I still do...
R: but it just wasn't meant to be.
S: I helped load her up and send her on her way to a new life, and I was left trying to rebuild mine...
T: again.
context.83:
A: A couple months ago, I was involved in an incident where I found out that my boyfriend was cheating on me.
B: I was out to dinner with him at a relatively nice restaurant, and I noticed that he would not stop checking his phone.
C: I had noticed that he had done this occasionally in the weeks preceding this event, but it had not been to this extent.
D: I immediately became suspicious.
E: I had been cheated on in past relationships, and I knew the warning signs.
F: I have a hard time executing confrontations, but I decided that enough was enough and I should definitely say something to him.
G: I asked him why he was being so weird lately, and he immediately became defensive.
H: I knew that this was not going to end well, and I did not want to cause a scene in public.
I: So, I said never mind and we ate the rest of our meal in silence.
J: When we left the restaurant and began driving home, he told me that he was going to drop me off at my house.
K: I was fully expecting to come over to his house and sleep over as we usually did, but he obviously did not have the same idea as me.
L: I asked him why and he told me that he wasn't feeling well and just wanted to go lay down.
M: Every part of me wanted to start an argument then and there but I stopped myself, and just remained quiet while he dropped me off.
N: I kissed him and said by like usual, but as soon as he pulled out of my driveway and left, I got in my car and proceeded to follow him.
O: I tried to remain as discrete as possible, and I wound up following him to a house that wasn't his.
P: I was him go inside, and I immediately knew that something was wrong.
Q: I got out of my car, knocked on the door, and when a woman answered the door, I immediately turned around got back in my car and went home.
R: I was completely devastated.
context.84:
A: Two and a half months ago, it was my birthday.
B:  I was celebrating in different ways with family and friends for the most of the day but the last place I expected to be by the end of the night was a Target.
C:  There's this girl I've known for about 13 years now.
D:  During those 13 years we would date, break up, date, break up.
E:  Eventually, the last time it happened, we stopped talking for the longest time period and to me it was like we both finally got the point that it wouldn't work out.
F:  This night, someone wanted to stop really quickly at Target because they needed something to drink and another person wanted to grab something for their phone.
G:  I break off alone and walk through the store to find something in particular and this familiar voice calls my name.
H:  I'm terrified and happy at the same time when I hear it because I know it's her.
I:  I think of all of the pain and heartbreak associated with her and how much I despised her after we stopped talking three years before.
J:  Yet, there she was, saying my name in the gentle yet comforting way she always did and smiling at me like I was something to be proud of.
K:  We walked towards each other, stunned, and embraced one another.
L:  For what seemed like ages, we just held each other and didn't say anything.
M:  Finally, after two minutes or so she whispered in my ear, "I miss you".
N:  I walked around with her that night and we talked for a while and caught up.
O:  She told me how awful her life had been going and expressed how she wanted to end it all.
P:  By the end of it all, I unblocked her from my phone and saw older texts flood in.
Q:  I ended up calling her again.
R:  It would probably turn out to be a mistake but realistically, even through all of the rough patches, she was the only one that really made sense to me.

context.86:
A: The last month has been pretty wild, but I'm finally starting to settle in.
B: Moving away from my hometown was a crazy change, and it's hard to believe I actually went through with it.
C: Most people don't.
D: Ultimately though I was just too bored in my hometown.
E: Seeing the same friends at the same places while drinking and eating the same things just grows so tiresome.
F: At least for me anyway.
G: It was my snoozefest of a desk job that forced me to pack up and head across the country for a new life, but the dull familiarity of the area was a big reason too.
H: I needed a change in the worst way.
I: I probably should give myself more credit for actually pulling such a change off too.
J: Even if that change means starting at the bottom at a new job and living in a tiny apartment.
K: But it's new and it's fresh, and that's the significant part.
L: I have a whole new area to explore here out west, and the weather here makes back home feel like Russia.
M: I know some of my friends are already thinking about coming to visit for a weekend or so.
N: In a way I don't want them out here, but I would certainly like to see them eventually.
O: This new life has the potential to really let me grow in ways that I never could back home, so I'm just pumped about getting to blaze my own trail at this point in my life.

context.90:
A: My live-in girlfriend left me after 3 years just recently.
B: She said it just didn't fell right, after 3 years! We bought a house together (luckily I put that in my name only), adopted a dog together and I was starting to plan out our future.
C: Then that rug was pulled out from underneath me, like Thanos snapping his damn finger.
D: Did I see it coming? Not at all, I thought she was the one.
E: Should I have seen it coming, yup! She would often travel to see her family which lived over an hour away, sometimes I'd go, sometimes not.
F: I found out she was talking to an ex of hers, but sometimes people make mistakes.
G: We found about it, and got on with life.
H: Her friends (who are still my friends which is odd) told me that they warned me, well I guess I was so in love it would have taken a Mack truck to hit me with it.
I: So here I am, heartbroken and just me and the dog (and yes, I told her I was keeping him and there wasn't going to be a discussion about it) so what do I do.
J: I begin to pack all her crap up, YUP, EVERY LAST BIT.
K: Why? Because I loved her, and I loved her family, and why punish her family by making them do it.
L: So there I am, boxing and storing lady's under garments and unmentionables.
M: All plates, pans, cooking utensils, eating utensils, sheets, towels, hell even lightbulbs.
N: She made me keep the furniture because it was too much, she said, but everything else that reminded me of her is gone.
O: I know what a divorce feels like, well except the whole court/lawyer fee thing.
P: Fast forward to now, I'm still without most of the crap she took with her.
Q: I bought a stainless steel pot set because I liked the look, but I can't cook on it for crap, so I don't use it much.
R: One set of sheets, 1 towel, paper plates and plastic forks.
S: I kinda wish I wasn't such a smartass and kept some of it, but I wanted her to know I could do it without her.
T: Can I though? MaybeThe dog thinks so anyway
context.91:
A: My wife had a back spasm in which she was unable to move and was in severe pain.
B:  This was a long tern event that had been building and had been getting worse and worse.
C:  We tried get an at home doctor to treat her, feeling that she would be unable to travel to be seen by a doctor.
D:  However, they would not approved such a doctor, without seeing her PCP first.
E:  I called 911, and the ambulance took her to the ER, where they gave her meds, which helped the back.
F:  They also gave her enough meds to get her to the PCP to be seen.
G:  However, the PCP needed to send her for a referral for her MRI test.
H:  At first, Soonercare denied the MRI.
I:  Then, after we put pressure on them they approved.

context.102:
A: Today, in Boulder Colorado, we made the long drive to the Rocky Mountain National Park.
B: It was truly an awe inspiring trip.
C: We drove through twisting roads, climbing ever higher, until we finally reached a height of over 11,000 feet.
D: During the trip we were able to pull over at a number of spots to take photos of the breathtaking scenery.
E: In Boulder, at the base of the Rocky Mountains, it was nearly 95 degrees, but at elevation the temperature was in the low 40s, which was quite shocking when climbing out of our SUV to take photos.
F: Just before we arrived at the highest gift shop/restaurant it began to rain quite hard, then changed to sleet as we ran for cover.
G: It was quite different from the 95 degree heat we had left only an hour and a half earlier.
H: Looking around at the snow capped mountains, some snow only a few dozen feet from where we were standing, demonstrated the ecological diversity that one can experience without having to leave the United States.
I: It was truly amazing eating lunch with my family and looking out at the snow on the Rocky Mountains.
J: We were able to get our fill of souvenirs which we stock up on every vacation so we can easily remember the places we've been and the things we did.
K: Later in the day, after the long drive down from the national park, we took our chances with white water rafting.
L: Our family had never been rafting before, let alone in rapids.
M: We had a spectacular time.
N: While the air temperature at river level was still in the 90s, the cold water felt refreshing with every rapid.
O: Being at one with nature and being able to spend an entire day experiencing some of the best that nature has to offer made me incredibly grateful to have had the opportunity to enjoy it with my family.
context.103:
A: I am a recovering alcoholic and she is a recovering codependent.
B: People of the same gender aren't supposed to sponsor one another in 12-Step programs.
C: But I ended up sponsoring her.
D: I helped her work the 12 Steps of Alcoholics Anonymous; she worked the Steps on her codependency.
E: We kept things "professional" and friendly for a few months.
F: But being that close to someone and watching her grow and learn to be happy and care for herself made me sort of fall in love with her.
G: I told her about my feelings and we started dating.
H: The relationship was taboo in that it's very frowned upon to date a sponsee.
I: It is also frowned upon to sponsor someone in a different 12-Step program.
J: But we became romantically involved anyway.
K: It was very difficult to talk about this with anyone because we got very little support, as would be expected.
L: But things are going well with us.
M: We have more or less proved everyone wrong.
N: We are very happy, and, to be honest, we are one of the healthiest couples I know.
O: I have high hopes for us, and she does, too.
context.104:
A: It was a beautiful day.
B: The sun was shining, it was warm and there wasn't a cloud in the sky.
C: This day would be a day that would forever change my life.
D: I had worked hard for what was about to happen and I had sacrificed much of my family life to reach this goal.
E: Today was the day that I would receive my Masters degree in Mechanical Engineering.
F: This had been a goal since I graduated with my Bachelors degree almost 25 years earlier.
G: Due to starting a family shortly after receiving my Bachelors degree, I had put off getting my Masters until my life had settled and I was financially capable of achieving this goal.
H: Well, that time came 2 years ago when I took the step of enrolling in school at the age of 46.
I: Did I need the Masters degree? Would it change my life? Would it allow me to make more money and be more successful? Well, yes I did need the degree and yes it would change my life.
J: I mainly did it to keep a promise that I made to my parents when I had started my Family.
K: It had been 25 years since I made that promise to them and now they wouldn't be here to witness it.
L: So many emotions ran through my mind.
M: Should I have done it earlier so that my parents could have been here? I knew that they were looking down upon me and this day and were just as proud as they would have been if they were here to see it with their own eyes.
N: What made this even more special is that I would receive my Degree alongside of my Daughter who on the exact day, was receiving her Masters degree in Chemical Engineering.
O: She has always been proud of here Dad but I know that she was more excited about my graduation than hers.
P: When my name was called, I stood up, walked up onto that stage and broke down in tears.
Q: I don't know what caused the sudden surge of emotions but part of me felt my parents right there on the stage with me.
R: I imagined my Mom crying and my Dad holding back tears of Joy.
S: When I received my degree, I turned and faced my Wife and yelled: we did it!.
T: She was overcome with emotion as well.
U: My Daughter was next and I waited on stage for her.
V: Upon receiving her degree, she ran to me and told me that she was proud of me.

context.108:
A: I have stumbled across something new to me lately.
B: Foraging for food in the landscape around me is a real thing and I can do it.
C: I started thinking about the plants around me when I saw a foraging video on YouTube.
D: A teacher was showing students about all of the edible plants in a park that happens to be near my house.
E: I was interested in the video as I have alot of experience with gardening and it dawned upon me that I could do this too.
F: I started looking up plants online and watching other videos about plant identification.
G: I started slowly by looking for one single type of plant and trying to identify it multiple times.
H: After I was confident that I could identify the plant, I ate a couple of leaves just to test out the effects of it.
I: I would wait a day and when nothing happened negative, I became more confident in my id's.
J: I ate more the next time and continued to find out as much as I could about the plants habitat and features.
K: Immersing myself in one plant at a time has been a great way to expand my knowledge.
L: Now I can identify many plants in my area.
M: I know the leaves, fruits, colors and features of a number of edible plants.
N: This has given me a food source other than buying food from the grocery.
O: It's amazing to see something all around you that was always there but you never saw before.
P: I am very glad to have stumbled upon this field of knowledge.
context.109:
A: That fateful day in June - June Seventh 2019 was a day like any other ordinary day.
B: It began the same, mid way also.
C: The night was what changed everything.
D: I developed and woke up to an extreme pain.
E: This pain radiated in my jaw, teeth, and neck, but was not the ordinary tooth or molar pain.
F: It was intense, extreme, unbearable.
G: Nothing would help it, not over the counter medications, or rest.
H: It was an intense, tremoring pain --- the kind you'd experience during a boxing match or worse, during surgery without numbing.
I: Being that I suffer from anxiety and am getting up there in age, I began to worry.
J: Was this very serious? I contemplated my options all the while suffering.
K: Do I go to the ER? A local Urgent Care? I tried everything I could think of to numb the pain.
L: It was almost as if I was bitten by a poisonous creature.
M: Was it a spider bite? So many things raced through my mind.
N: Eventually, I realized the inside of my mouth was irritated.
O: This was possibly from spicy food or acid reflux, and that it appeared to be possibly infected.
P: After finally coming to and going to the ER, this was confirmed.
Q: I was given antibiotics and went home.
R: I have since fully recuperated thankfully.

context.113:
A: July 14, 2019On the morning of July 14th myself, my husband, my brother, my niece and my sister and her husband all decided to hike to the top of Mt.
B: Leconte in the Smoky Mountain National Park.
C:  We had attempted this before but were unable to make it to the top because of an injury to my daughter.
D:  She had had knee surgery in the past and was unable to make it to the top due to her knee pain.
E:  WE were determined we were going to make it this time.
F:  WE started at around 8:00 am that morning.
G:  Although it was very hard because it was up hill the whole way I made it to the top.
H:  Two of our party did not make it to the top but tried their best.
I:  Of the ones who made it, it took us 4 hours to make it all the way to the top.
J:  We were exahausted but elated we had reached our goal!  The way down didn't take nearly as long because it was mostly down hill.

L:  On our way back down we met up with the two in our party who did not make it to the top although they had made great progress.
M:  They were disappointed and vowed to make it to the top the next time we went.

context.114:

C: She was laying on her dog bed and breathing heavily.
D: Just before it was time to go I told my fiance to go without me.
E: There was no way that I was leaving my dog alone.
F: I laid her head on my lap.
G: I played her songs that we had listened to together over the years.
H: She was mostly quiet as I stroked her head.
I: I told her stories about our life together.
J: I told her what a great dog and friend she had been.
K: I told her that it was okay to go.
L: It would hurt me worse than I could imagine but I had to let her go.
M: It was only about a half hour after my fiance left.
N: I knew something was different.
O: My dogs breathing changed and she seemed agitated.
P: She let out a few rattling breathes and then she was gone.
Q: I felt like my heart was literally ripped out.
context.115:
A: I've read the full four book lonesome dove series and I consider it to be among the finest of the great western classics.
B: I've also seen the numerous depictions in film of McMurtry's stories.
C: I first discovered the adventures of Call and McCrae in my freshman year of high school.
D: My new girlfriend at the time (who considered herself a bit of a cowgirl) was obsessed with the series.
E: She wasn't exaggerating to say she'd tried her hand at being a cowboy; she once joined an old fashioned cattle drive that took a herd of livestock from idaho to montana by horse.
F: She was so taken by the series and it's characters that she even had her bicep tattooed with a full half-sleeve of McCrae rearing back on a horse.
G: It was quite good work and I was quite jealous.
H: I wouldn't mind going back to visit some of the timeless characters in those novels, they really do hold up in their unflinching depiction of the old american west, blemishes and all.
I: Some of the most profound things I took from the stories were the details surrounding the cultures of the various native american tribes the cowboys encounter along the journeys.
J: It's very interesting to know how the comanches and apaches were so desperately feared, and some other tribes simply were not as their way of life was much different.
K: It also doesn't surprise me that plains native americans would be so tough and willing to fight to defend themselves given the overall harsh environment of north and west texas.
L: One of the most striking moments in the series is when the long time adversary of Call and McCrae, the former chief of the comanches, is on his death-bed and seeks a personal journey to die alone and apart from his tribe.
M: The cowboys have fought him for decades and want nothing but vengeance but they never get it.
N: Instead the reader is treated to a profound moment of acceptance from an incredibly strong-willed man as he ushers himself from his world.
O: It is truly one of my favorite books and having grown up in Texas, I some sense of pride imagining that events as romantic if at time brutal  probably took place.
P: It makes me feel at the very least that Texas is as unique a state as we Texans would like to believe and often proclaim.
context.116:
A: 4 months ago i kept my baby boy seated on the floor of my living room, playing with his toys, i removed my eyes from him for about 2 minutes cause i need to reply tomy messages online.
B: after about 2 minute i had to lift my eyes to look at him to my greatest surprised he crawled away from where i kept him to a little space in front of him.
C: i was so amazed and surprised.
D: when this happened some thought came to my mind, that my baby could now begin to crawl.
E: this means this reduced his reliance on me for carrying him around always.
F: my baby will definitely entertain himself crawling on the floor, picking up his toys and from ther he will be able to stand holding something and before i know he will take his first step.
G: so i felt a great sigh of relief and i was so happy and proud of him.
H: Although, There are a number of critical breakthroughs that your infant will reach early in life.
I: From straightforward assignments like sitting up or lifting their head to more progressed developments like rolling over, these small accomplishments are continuously inspiring.
J: But there’s nothing very like seeing your baby crawling for the primary time.
K: Many guardians are on edge to see their child crawl and closely screen their baby’s improvements.
L: Of course, there’s completely nothing off-base with that! In any case, it’s vital to keep in mind that all babies are diverse and take after a distinctive advancement path.
M: Most babies begin to crawl somewhere between 6 and 10 months of age.
N: my baby started crawling at 8 months of age.
context.117:
A: My  cousins from my dad's side of the family and from  out of town called and said they were coming in .
B: They said it would be a reunion .
C: I asked what they wanted me to bring and they told some things I could bring.
D: I asked them why were they doing it because I thought maybe my dad was sick and nobody informed me of it.
E: He is turning ninety this year .
F: The one cousin I asked said just to come in, I think.
G: So it kind of worried me  that something might be wrong with him.
H:  But they came in and a lot of people were there and we had a good time.
I: We ate and took pictures and showed each other pictures of all our families and people in our family who had died.
J:  It was sad because our grandparents had died and all of my cousins parents had died .
K: There was no one left on my dad's side but him.
L: All his brothers and sisters and their spouses were dead.
M: We gave each other small gifts and made to go boxes of left over food for everyone and then cleaned up the kitchen.
N: One of my cousins was a photographer and we went outside and took a lot of outdoor pictures of everyone and later he put them online for us.
O: It was good to see everyone and it felt like when we were all kids and were at our grandparents house eating her food and seeing each other, like at Christmas or Thanksgiving.
P:  Most of them brought the food that grandma made when we were growing up so that made it feel even more like a family reunion .
Q:  It was a fun day and sad also when my dad gave a little speech at the end and said how proud he was of all of us.
R: He teared up some and I think everyone else did too.
S: It was sad because everyone has to die and we aren't here for very long.
T: It made us aware of that I think and it was sad but also fun to see everyone.
U:  We made plans to see each other again in September and I am looking forward to that .
V: Some of them have to fly in so not sure how many will make it.
W:  I will go to that event since it is only an hour and a half away from me and an easy drive.
context.118:
A: Okay, it has been several months since i came back from my primary doctor's visit.
B: My primary doctor gave my phone number to the best specialist at the hospital.
C: Then it took like a week to hear back from the people who schedule appointments at the hospital.
D: It was a matter of me going to hospital to see why they hadn't called me, when my primary doctor said that someone from the hospital would.
E: It took weeks to see a urinary specialist.
F: I don't know the exact length, but i had to wait a couple of weeks just so he can hear my side of the story and see what steps he can take with me.
G: I went to my first visit with the urinary specialist on July 27, now i'm going back to see him tomorrow (August 27, 2019).
H: After my first visit with the urine specialist, he gave me a 2 week supply of blue/purple pills that said that these pills might cure me and get me back to normal.
I: But it didn't.
J: I took them and turned my pee to a blue color, which on the package, it said that it was normal.
K: But it didn't cure my frequent urination, which is what i'm going through right now.
L: I wish the health care industry in america would be a lot more efficient and not have someone that is poor and not a lot of money have them wait an eternity for treatment.
M: But, i am going to see him tomorrow, that is what is important.
N: What the urinary specialist told me was they're going to ultra sound my kidneys.
O: Then they're going to look inside my urine hole while i'm under anesthesia.
P: I'm hoping this will end good, not bad.
Q: Hope for a speedy recovery, so i can go back to work like i used to 2 years ago.
