context.121:
A: I always knew her life would turn this way.
B: Sad to say, I know.
C: I was realistic about it.
D: I was logical.
E:  Weirdly so, while I was realistic about it, I felt that I was also in denial about many things.
F: It took a very long time to realize who she really was and what her intentions were.
G: I still remember the time when it dawned on me, all that she had done to me.
H: I remember it all sinking in.
I: I was disappointed.
J: It was hurtful.
K: I genuinely cared for her and it was obvious to me that it wasn't really reciprocal.
L: She was selfish for a very long time.
M: I didn't think cutting her out of my life would lead to her demise.
N: I am not even sure that's what caused it.
O:  Maybe the timing was just a coincidence.
P: I knew cutting her out of my life would hurt her.
Q: I never imagined it would cause her life to unravel.
R: Again, I don't even know if me cutting her out of my life was what caused her life to unravel.
S: I imagine it played somewhat of a role, though.
T: When my grandparents sat me down and described how she had hit rock bottom just a week ago, I was shocked.
U: I don't really know why I was shocked, though.
V: She never really was on the right track in life.
W: Her alcoholism finally caught up with her.
X: How could you end up fired, in jail and confessing to alcoholism all in a matter of four days! My family was torn apart by it and I decided not to stick around for it.
context.122:
A: Three weeks ago, my life changed for the better.
B:  I came face-to-face with how I was truly missing out on life, on what matters most.
C:  Unlike some people that realize too late they missed time with a loved one, I get to start over now.
D:  The day started like any other day.
E:  I mindlessly went through my routine, made sure my spouse was ready for work, and dropped my kid off at school.
F:  Nothing different happened that morning or during that day.
G:  Like normal, I just did my job, made some money, ran errands, cleaned the house, and started some things for dinner.
H:  I had coffee with my friend, chatting about our many responsibilities and how grateful we were for any breaks from spending time with others, how heavy our workloads were and how school gave us a little break in our day from childcare.
I: That afternoon, I went to go pick up my kid from school.
J:  I ended up driving behind that same friend, who had kids in the same school.
K:  There was a school bus stopped along the rode, which was a rural highway.
L:  I saw it and slowed down, but my friend in front of my didn't see it.
M:  She ran right over children who were getting off the bus.
N:  The kids were killed in that horrible accident.
O:  My friend couldn't even offer condolences; she was just saying how busy she was and that she didn't see.
P:  She was too busy to see the bus stopped, too busy to see the precious lives in front of her...too busy...too busy.
Q:  I picked up my kid and went home, too moved to eat dinner that night.
R:  I could have been that woman: too busy to see; too busy with what?  Too busy with chores that never end to spend precious time with loved ones?  Too busy to spend time praying, or doing worthwhile hobbies that I enjoy?  Am I too busy to pass those hobbies, those precious moments and memories on to my kids?  I realized that I had been going through life numb, as if on auto-pilot, just checking off tasks on a list.
S:  All the while, the things that truly matter were passing me by.
T:  I hugged my spouse and child close, and determined that I would no longer miss what's important in life.
U:  Each day is precious:  I will remember and truly learn to live.
context.123:
A: My family went on a trip out West this Summer.
B: We visited many places, but the one we all enjoyed the most was Bad Lands National Park.
C: I think the reason we all enjoyed it so much is because it was something that my parents, myself, and my young children all could enjoy together.
D: The beauty was amazing, and he wildlife and natural land forms were something so very different than we had ever experienced before.
E: We were able to observe American Bison on the prairie.
F: The sheer size of the creatures is what stands out in my memory to this day.
G: My children still talk about the bison, and we have included studying these animals during our homeschooling days.
H: We also saw huge eagles and hawks! The wildlife that my children probably enjoyed the most were the prairie dogs, as they were able to get fairly close to them! The vast rock formations, and huge canyon was amazing.
I: It was like a giant bowl in the middle of the prairie! We learned about the formation of the rocks, and you could see the different layers of sediment in the rocks.
J: We spent the greater part of a day just exploring the different areas, pulling off at all of the scenic outlooks! It was an amazing family memory! I can't wait to go back when my wife and oldest son can join us!
context.124:
A: About six months ago, I went to the eye doctor to get my eyes checked.
B: My eyes were getting tired quickly and I was experiencing a lot of mild headaches due to eyestrain.
C: The doctor did a thorough examination and immediately noticed how terribly misaligned they were.
D: He recommended me to a surgeon to get my eyes aligned.
E: I have had misaligned eyes for almost half a century and had never considered surgery, because my older sister had surgery for her misaligned eyes and is now practically blind in one eye.
F: I had decided to live with my condition and when I became an adult, I went through one year of vision therapy to correct the problem.
G: Vision therapy did help, but over time my eyes went back to their old ways and turned in very significantly.
H: The doctor explained to me that my condition is a little different from my sister's and that surgery will not cause me to lose vision, because I have alternating vision and my sister had another condition that caused her to shut one eye off completely.
I: He said that at my age, surgery was really the only answer.
J: So, I scheduled an appointment with a surgeon and had an evaluation done.
K: The surgeon put all kinds of different prisms up to my left eye and immediately I saw double.
L: The surgeon worked with me for several minutes and finally my eyes adjusted some.
M: She told me that my left eye turned inward 70-80 points and she could only correct it to 40 points without me seeing double.
N: She decided that it would be beneficial to do surgery on my right eye also, so that I can have at least 50 points of correction.
O: I talked to my husband about the situation and he thought it was a good idea to have the surgery done.
P: The surgery scheduler didn't contact me until three months later and informed me that I would have to go back down for a new evaluation before the surgery.
Q: I told her that if this was the case, I was not interested, because we had already paid $600 out of pocket for the first evaluation.
R: She talked with the surgeon and the surgeon told her that I did not need a second evaluation, so the surgery was scheduled for August.
S: Three weeks ago, my husband took me to the eye hospital and I underwent surgery on both of my eyes and I cannot believe how having mostly aligned eyes has changed my life! My crossed eyes have always caused people to look at me a little funny and some companies have not wanted to hire me, thinking there was something wrong with me.
T: Children have always stared at me and asked why my eyes are so crossed.
U: This is no longer a problem! Just last week, I took a trip into town to the grocery store and was amazed at how much better I was treated.
V: It is also wonderful to get up in the morning and have almost perfectly aligned eyes while looking in the mirror getting ready for the day!
context.125:
A: Today I am watching my granddaughter while my son and his girlfriend are both at work.
B:  The child spends most of her time with me.
C: Over the past few months CPS has twice assigned me as a guardian protector of sorts of the child due to her mother.
D:  Her mother has now been diagnosed with a mental disorder and is being watched closely for that and for drug use.
E:  It's hard having them all in the home.
F:  I have been trying to help all of them.
G:  I try to help the mother to understand how to be a mother and to keep clean of drugs.
H: I try to help the baby to be healthy mentally and physically.
I: I also spend time trying to help my son to be strong enough to raise the child on his own if he has to.
J:  This morning I cleaned up the baby bottles and high chair.
K: It is something I do every day as the mother does not understand keeping things clean.
L:  I just got through feeding the baby lunch.
M:  I'll be alone with her until about six tonight.
N:  In truth, I am a sort of part time mother to her.
O:  It will soon be time to put her down for a nap.
P:  I have grown close to her.
Q: I hope every day that she has a bright and safe future.
R: I worry all the time about what will happen if CPS gives her back to her mother.
context.126:
A: After the pain - The healing.
B: After the Urgent Care visit and the pain subsided, I worried it might come back.
C: The whole day I kept ice firmly pressed against the area, trying my best to keep it at bay.
D: The anxiousness and anxiety it caused was not good.
E: It kept me from sleeping or focusing well, and also from working.
F: I worried - will I need to take more pain medicine? Will the infection return? Thankfully, with full rest, mouth rinse, and a positive outlook, the pain was no more.
G: Now, I make sure to rinse daily with this unique mouth wash and so far it's been pretty positive.
H: Also of note, I ended up making up my work and being given reduced hours, which helped me make up the amount of money lost.
I: The doctor at the Urgent Care Center stated it appeared to be an infection resulting from impacted wisdom teeth.
J: Wisdom Teeth come in around 17 years of age, or start to and eventually become impacted.
K: Impaction leads to vision problems, pain, on site infection, and shifting teeth among other things.
L: I have experienced some pain for years over this, but only recently, has it become so bad that it incapacitates me.
M: While I personally do not want to undergo wisdom tooth extraction, I definitely recommend it if you suffer.
context.127:
A: My dad passed away last month.
B: I knew he was sick, but it was still such a shock.
C: He used to work in Detroit.
D: He would clean the car parts in a chemical solution without gloves.
E: He would just dip them in.
F: Well, He got cancer behind one of his kidneys.
G: The doctors told him this cancer was only caused by a specific chemical.
H: I called him while he was in the hospital and he told me not to worry.
I: He said, "kiddo, I love you, I will always take care of you." I thought he meant in the sense of how a parent loves their child after they pass away.
J: I was able to fly over and see my dad before he died.
K: As I was cleaning up the house afterwards, a lawyer showed up.
L: I didn't think anything of it.
M: Paperwork to sign cause dad passed away.
N: Ni biggie.
O: Did not think of it again til yesterday.
P: Yesterday a huge check showed up from dad.
Q: Huge.
context.128:
A: I went for my follow-up appointment in October.
B: I received the best news that I could have hoped for.
C: I am all good and cancer free! This has been a rollercoaster of a year.
D: I have been able to relax and enjoy the holidays with my family knowing that I'm not going to be leaving them any time soon.
E: Well, I know that anything could happen but at least it's not that! I am so glad that I went for that exam last spring.
F: I can't imagine how this would have gone had the cancer not been found when it was.
G: I have so many plans for the future now.
H: I feel like I had been taking so many things for granted.
I: I want to follow through on all those things that I just never made time for.
J: It's amazing how a scare like this can change your perspective.
K: I have two young children and a wonderful life.
L: Sometimes I get really upset thinking what would have happened if my PSA results had not been good.
M: I'm also grateful that I have such great health insurance.
N: It is such a privilege that this scare didn't also bankrupt us.
O: I am relieved that my treatment didn't put us in debt.
context.129:
A: My sister-in-law was a very special person to me and an important part of our lives.
B:  She had some health issues in her adult life.
C:  She was diagnosed with diabetes when she was in her 40's.
D:  She had surgery on her neck a few months before she passed away.
E:  She was scheduled to have knee replacement surgery before she passed away.
F:  She was having a normal day on the day she passed away.
G:  She had a meeting with someone from her church that morning.
H:  She went outside to show her friend her garden and then her friend left.
I:  She was in her garden when she suddenly had a massive aneurysm.
J:  We had video footage from security cameras to show us exactly what happened.
K:  She put her hands to her head and then she dropped to 1 knee.
L:  She braced herself temporarily before falling to the ground completely.
M:  My brother found her a few minutes later and called an ambulance.
N:  She was basically on life support from that time until she passed away about 8 hours later.
O:  It has been 5 months since it happened and it still seems so surreal.
P:  I miss her smile and I miss her laugh.
Q:  She had the best laugh!  It will be difficult when our family gets together for the holidays this year but we will pull together and honor her in the best way possible.
context.130:
A: Nine months ago, I had a little panic.
B: My graduation ceremony was set back.
C: The cause was my dry cleaner was late on delivering my cloth of the day.
D: This made my feet sweaty.
E: This got resolved and I had the ceremony.
F: I celebrated in a big style with my family and friends.
G: My mom gave me a big hug and had some tears.
H: My dad shook my hand and also had tears.
I: My friends all jumped up and down at the ceremony.
J: We all had a great time.
K: I had some tears that I was finally done with school.
L: We all went out for some pizza to celebrate.
M: I got a meat lovers by myself.
N: I barely finished the pizza.
O: I will remember this forever.
context.131:
A: October, I feel you.
B: The days are becoming shorter, cooler.
C: Birthdays and holidays are slowly coming into focus.
D: The end of the year is near.
E: As always,  I reflect.
F: I enjoy January 1st.
G: Not the recounting of another year gone, or resolutions and promises unfulfilled, but the opportunity to begin anew.
H: Yes, I will make promises I will never keep.
I: I know who I am though.
J: My intentions are good.
K: I'll promise to read more.
L: A few classics, a few books for guilty pleasures.
M: I'll promise myself to exercise more.
N: Get healthy and have more energy for my kids when I get home.
O: I'll promise to volunteer.
P: Leaving the world a better place, making connections with those around me, doing good when no one is looking.
Q: I'll make promises to travel more.
R: This is never really a promise, but a reminder that life is short, the world is small, and if I do not put time aside to see new places "that day" will never come.
S: So, October, I guess I am glad to see you.
T: You are my first step in winter to a new year.
context.132:
A: In May, one of my close friends from high school graduated from medical school.
B: I originally wanted to attend the ceremony but I had to go out of town for my brother's graduation.
C: Fortunately, my friend was having a party as well.
D: When I got to the party I saw some classmates that I hadn't seen for many years.
E: It was an interesting reminder of how I didn't like one of those girls.
F: I didn't realize how fancy or big the party was going to be.
G: Everyone was dressed up and my friend's relatives from Africa were all arriving.
H: Clearly, it was a really big deal.
I: As the night progressed, we ate and danced and talked.
J: I was really happy I could be there for my friend.
K: Finally after a few hours, people began making speeches.
L: This included my friend's father, a Cameroonian uncle/preacher, and my friend herself.
M: During her speech, she highlighted her relative's recent accomplishments including getting into pharmacy school and their own graduations.
N: Then she started talking about me! I thought it was going to be family only but then I heard my name.
O: I was not expecting to have the spotlight on me, no matter how briefly, in front of nearly a hundred people.
P: I'm sure the moment got caught by the videographer.
Q: I was very happy to hear that my friend would include me in her special moment.
R: It was a nice reminder of how much our friendship has meant over the years.
context.133:
A: Dear Diary, Today was a great day!  I am always nervous when I get reviewed at work.
B:  Today was no exception.
C:  I knew everyone was getting their projects reviewed.
D:  The best one would be selected to be implemented by the boss.
E:  That meant that the winner would be in charge of a team leading the project.
F:  I wanted this very badly.
G:  I have been working  here for 6 months and wanted a chance to show my leadership ability as well as my creativity.
H:  The boss brought everyone in the conference room to announce the results.
I:  There were many amazing project ideas.
J: I was so excited when I found out that mine had won!  It was very rewarding after all the hard work that I put into it.
K:  I am happy to be able to be noticed for my hard work.
L:  Hopefully, this will only propel me forward at work.
M:  I can't wait to share the news with my family!
context.134:
A: This move is much different than I thought it would be.
B:  It has been hard to adjust to a new environment.
C:  There is too much pressure and I feel like I am failing.
D: I see others do much better than me and take on more responsibility.
E:  I want to do well but I don't know if I can do it.
F:  Anytime that I feel like I am making progress there are more steps back.
G:  More of what I want to do seems out of reach.
H:  I am afraid that it was a mistake.
I:  My life back home was easier.
J:  It was easier to do the same thing again and again.
K: It was easier to have the same places to go and not be too concerned about what to do next.
L: I would like an easier job.
M:  I received a raise but not by much.
N:  I am not sure if it was worth it but I am here now.
O:  I cannot change the past and I need to move forward.
P:  The was is not what I expected.
context.135:
A: It was a hot summer day in April.
B: My phone rang and I didn't recognize the number.
C: I don't usually pick up unknown numbers.
D: I decided to pick it up today  because I wasn't that busy.
E: It was my step-father.
F: He wanted to see how I was doing even though we hadn't spoken in several years.
G: Growing up we had a rocky relationship.
H: We never really got along and argued a lot.
I: I felt like he always tried to be my dad and I didn't want him to.
J: Sometimes our arguments turned physical.
K: But now that we were on the phone our conversation was calm.
L: We spoke about my childhood and his relationship with my mother.
M: It was a rough conversation at first but then it got better over time.
N: The conversation was emotional and we caught up for a bit before hanging up.
O: We agreed we would try to stay in tough more often.
context.136:
A: I was grocery shopping a few weeks ago.
B: I had purchased my items and was leaving the store.
C: I noticed an older woman with a cart of groceries.
D: She was walking home and was trying to figure out a way to carry all of her bags.
E: I live across the street from the grocery store so I told myself i should offer some assistance to her.
F: I approached her and offered my help.
G: I told her i would drop my things off at home and come back to help her carry some things.
H: She lived nearby as well.
I: So i did exactly that.
J: I dropped my things off at home, and came back to the store to help her carry her bags to her home.
K: She was very appreciative of my help.
L: She wanted to give me a cake she had made and i declined.
M: Instead we talked for a few minutes, exchanged names and phone numbers and laughed about the oddities of life.
N: We had a good time together.
O:  I learned that she lived alone the home so grocery shopping or shopping of any kind is a challenge.
P: I told her we could go for coffee sometime as a thank you.
Q: I felt good about helping her.
R: I think it's important to help others when we are able and i was able to help her.
S: I wanted to help her.
T: She's a lovely woman and now we are friends.
U: She knows she can count on me to help if she needs it.
V:  I visit with her once a week.
W: We have coffee at her home, out on her patio, or in a coffee shop and just talk.
X: I have helped her plant flowers and other items.
Y: She started a garden this summer and I help her with that as well.
context.137:
A: My family and I volunteer for a charity that feeds the homeless.
B: One Saturday each month, we go to the charity's commissary, make 135 sandwiches and load the charity's truck with sandwiches, fruit, snacks, and bottles of water.
C: Then we deliver the food directly to the homeless downtown.
D: A few months ago, our Saturday fell on the day before Easter.
E: I wanted to do something special for the homeless.
F: I came up with a few suggestions that were roundly rejected by my very moody teenage daughter.
G: Frustrated, I suggested that she come up with some ideas, then.
H: She went up to her room with stomps in the place of footsteps.
I: Thinking she would summarily forget the task, I decided to go with my first idea of making hard boiled eggs and dyeing them as a family.
J: But soon, my daughter came down the stairs (much lighter this time).
K: She wanted to put mini-chocolate bars in plastic eggs and deliver them with the sandwiches.
L:  So we purchased 135 plastic eggs and chocolates and then my daughter, son, husband, and I assembled them to go with the food.
M: The next day, as we made our deliveries, I watched my daughter's face with as much fascination as I watched the faces of our homeless friends as they opened their eggs.
N: Delight and happiness lit up the faces of the homeless as they found their "surprises."And as she watched, joyful tears slipped onto my daughter's cheeks.
O: She tried not to let me or my husband see.
P: But we did.
context.138:
A: It was our first ever family reunion and it was really cool.
B: We weren't able to really do this before besides random holiday meet ups sporadically so it really was a nice change of pace.
C: We got to really spend some time together that wasn't rushed and catch up on at least a decade worth of misc stuff.
D: It was surprising how much fun it was because I always had memories of being bored out of my mind.
E: I guess when you're a kid/teen you would rather be doing other stuff but now that I'm an adult I understood the value of it.
F: I wish I could go back in time and tell myself not to squander these moments as we never know if they will be the last.
G: Some of my family had passed away in the time frame from when we last met up for the holidays and the reunion so I won't ever get to spend time with them again and that sucks.
H: It was really good to see my aunt and uncle again as they are the most similar to myself with our love for technology and in general relaxed personalities.
I: I wish I had connected with them much sooner but when my parents divorced people kind of took sides and it was hard to reach over the divide.
J: I won't make that mistake again I want to keep these relationships going so we did promise to keep in weekly or bi weekly contact.
K: We are all in general bad at communication so hopefully we can keep this up and I will try to take control of it being the youngest.
L: I guess personally I am at fault for the divide when it comes to this family.
M: I should've been the one to really reconnect us years ago but I was just generally absorbed in the grind of life and my immediate friends/family that I didn't try.
N: I will look at my relationships with my distant family and friends more so we stay more connected.
O: It was great to write about this again because I feel like this is a different view from the last time since I have been chatting with my family more since the last time I did this.
context.139:
A: I loved that trip with my turtle.
B: He was so cute.
C: He did struggle in his cage but that's okay.
D: Once we landed I let him out to run around.
E: He was so happy to get off.
F: THe first thing he did was run around and lay in the grass in the sun.
G: He was so cute.
H: I love my turtle so much.
I: He did meet this one kid who wanted to hold him.
J: I asked his parents if it was okay and they said yes.
K: So I let him hold him but then he dropped him.
L: He dropped my baby turtle on the floor of that filthy airplane.
M: I was so upset.
N: Once we got to the hotel I gave him a bath immediately.
O: He got so clean after that.
P: I was so mad at that little brat.
Q: I don't know how brain dead you can be to drop a turtle but that was infuriating.
R: That is the last time I let a kid touch my pet turtle.
context.140:
A: The event that was most memorable and striking to me within the last few months was graduating with my teaching credential and master's degree.
B: This is something that I have been dreaming about for years.
C: It was something that I worked on for years by taking tests, writing papers, and attending classes.
D: There were countless nights studying and worrying.
E: Student teaching was long and expensive since I had to pay to not work.
F: It was also exhausting working full-time and then taking classes at night.
G: To finally be done with my credential and master's was a huge accomplishment for me.
H: Walking down the stage at graduation felt amazing.
I: I realized that this was likely the last time that I would attend a graduation as a student.
J: That is, unless I decide to go back for my doctorate degree.
K: However, whether I decide to go back for another graduate-level degree or not, the accomplishment of getting my master's degree can never be taken away from me.
L: My parents and grandparents were extremely proud.
M: My long-term boyfriend was extremely proud.
N: I realized that the next time I attend a graduation will likely be for my students, since I am trying to teach high school level students.
O: It feels nice to pass the torch to them.
context.141:
A: I went to my older brothers wedding a few months ago! I never thought he'd actually get married--he didn't seem the type to be interested.
B: I bet his girlfriend convinced him, he's just a really passive guy.
C: I don't even think he really cares about this kind of thing, it's all for show.
D: He's very wealthy, so everything looks straight out of Gatsby in the venue.
E: It's beautiful, and I feel a bit of jealousy.
F: But it's my brother! I love him, and I'm his best man! I helped him organize everything, got a wedding planner and all of that.
G: I was probably more excited than him about organizing all of this--I'm a bit of a control freak.
H: The rest is a little bit hazy, I drank a little too much at the start, so the rest was a blur.
I: Apparently I didn't screw anything up, though, so I guess I wasn't as messed up as a I felt.
J: We ended up going to dinner after, his wife was so happy.
K: They announced they would be departing for their honeymoon within the next week, and that his wife was actually pregnant.
L: I was shocked, but that explained a lot in regards to the fact he actually agreed to get married.
M: I was happy, but a little disappointed in him.
context.142:
A: My husband and I celebrated out tenth anniversary three months ago in May.
B: We wanted to do something special to commemorate our love and devotion.
C: We decided to renew our vows in front of friends and family.
D: We all traveled to Charleston, South Carolina.
E: It is a romantic town with personality and history.
F: We thought it would be fitting for our relationship.
G: It was a romantic weekend of love and memories.
H: We had 40 guests from all over the country.
I: We spent the weekend eat, drinking, and being merry.
J: We shopped and hit all of the tourist destinations.
K: Everyone had a blast spending time together.
L: Our actual renewal ceremony was lovely.
M: I wore a white dress and our kids were in the bridal party.
N: There were beautiful floral arrangements and a huge vanilla cake.
O: I was thrilled to have our children present to partake in the family love.
context.143:
A: Three weeks ago, my dog died.
B: I was not there.
C: I had been out of town visiting family.
D: When I was told that she was doing well and things were looking dire, I made last-minute plans to rush home.
E: In the middle of the night, my only real option as a non-driver was Greyhound.
F: As luck would have it, there was a proper route from where I was to where I was going.
G: I booked it, and rushed to pack and leave to get to the station (20 minutes away, 90 minutes before departure).
H: When I got there, I was denied the ability to board.
I: My identification had recently expired.
J: I told them my story; begged, pleaded.
K: Nothing.
L: I felt profoundly hopeless, hysterical, self-loathing, and broken.
M: With no other options, I returned to where I was staying.
N: As it turned out, I would not have made it.
O: My dog went sometime in her sleep in the night before I would have arrived.
P: I hadn't seen her in her last two months, and I couldn't see her before she went.
Q: It absolutely haunts me.
R: My parents had her cremated.
S: I still haven't been able to go back home.
T: It will never feel like home again.
U: Not without her.
context.144:
A: My cousin got married about three months ago.
B: Her husband's father owns a farm up in the country, and that's where they had the wedding.
C: It was a beautiful view of the fields at the ceremony, but it was way too hot for an outdoor wedding.
D: The reception was inside one of the storage facilities, so that didn't help.
E: They were having issues with the food too, as there wasn't enough of it and they had to order pizza.
F: It was nice going and seeing family members I hadn't seen in a long time.
G: We got a big picture with all the cousins together.
H: Some of my cousins live in England, so it was great to see them and catch up.
I: The most memorable thing about the wedding was the video they played about my cousin and her husband's history.
J: It was well put together and emotional.
K: Once it got dark the heat wasn't so bad, and at least the portable bathrooms they provided were air conditioned.
L: It was only an hour away from where I live too so it was an easy drive back and forth.
M: They offered hotels for any guests who wanted to stay the night, but I'd rather sleep in my own bed.
N: It was definitely a memorable night.
O: I don't get out to the country often.
context.145:
A: I was always making excuses not to go back to school and complete my Masters degree.
B: Before long over 20 years passed and I realized something was missing, I wanted a Masters degree, it never left my mind.
C: The opportunity was present and I am so glad I finally took it.
D: But what really matters on this special day is not only proving to myself I could do it, but showing my Daughter to never give up.
E: The pride I feel inside from accomplishing my goal, but the feeling of completeness there is from my Daughter receiving her Masters the same day is indescribable.
F: I remember what started me on this quest, my parents wanted me to be "educated" and in their eyes it meant a Masters degree.
G: The told me continuously to start classes, to get moving on it, at times there were almost relentless about it.
H: I could see it in their eyes, how very much they wanted me to complete my education, I felt that drive in them, that sense of pride they would have in me.
I: Before they passed away I made a promise, to me I took an oath in their presence, that I would no matter what complete my Masters degree.
J: They never let me forget that promise, my mother reminded me of it daily, my father talked about it often and I carried that around with me until this day.
K: I remember sharing the story with my Daughter, the promise I made to her grandparents and what it meant to them and me.
L: At first she could not grasp the meaning of it all to me, the sense of gratitude I had for my parents as well as what it meant to them for me to get my higher level degree.
M: I finally got through to my daughter about how I felt, how my parents felt and how to me it tied in with her getting her Masters on the same day.
N: She always knew how I beam with pride over her, all her accomplishments and dedication to studying.
O: It brought me great happiness to be able to share the day with her, to get a degree the same time she did.
P: I feel inside now a true sense of calm, knowing my family is proud of me, I set a good example for my daughter and my parents can rest.
Q: I told my daughter my life is finally complete, and I feel a true sense of circle and self, and that my parents can finally rest in peace with an oath kept.
context.146:
A: He still does not love me the same i see his face everyday and its still the same.

D: How can i want to live with myself after all of this im just an embarrassment.

G: I was a fool for thinking i can find love i muat of been out my mind.
H: My mom tried to tell me though she tried to tell me to take care of myself.
I: Now i am going to try to regain my pothetic life and see were i left off.
J: I know one thing i am going to go for my music that is the only thing o have left now and i am slowly losing that.
K: My mind has been in and out im doubting myself more than ever i am just a loser.
L: What can i do who can help me i just need someone as a friend right now.
M: I can belive i came this low in this miserable life.

context.147:
A: What a wild ride this life has been so far.
B: The ups, the downs and everything in between.
C: My beautiful bride and I have been married for two years now.
D: Our anniversary is tomorrow and we're going on a fabulous date of dinner around Newport Harbor.
E: As I reflect back, I think to how nervous I was to even ask her to marry me.
F: I bought the ring five months before I actually asked her.
G: I practiced what I would say for months and just couldn't work up the nerve.
H: Finally, after all that, I popped the question.
I: I got down on one knee and asked her to marry me.
J: And she said yes! She actually said yes, the most beautiful woman in the world agreed to marry me, some schmuck from Brooklyn.
K: We got married just one month later and the most beautiful service ever.
L: We were married at the Little White Wedding Chapel in Las Vegas.
M: Everyone was there, our parents, our friends and even Elvis made an apppearance! We stayed the Mirage just up the street and just had the most wonderful time.
N: The last two years have just been so amazing, I can't wait to see what the future holds.
context.148:
A: It was a hot day in July that our community decided to paint a mural on an intersection for public art.
B: I had decided to volunteer to help paint.
C: I signed up for the morning shift and arrived a bit early.
D:  They had started to paint the street with primer for where the design would be painted.
E: While I waited for that to be finished, I signed in so that the city could keep track of the amount of volunteer hours that everyone preformed.
F: I then was instructed to have some of the donuts and water that had been brought.
G: As I ate my donut, I noticed a couple chickens crossing the road.
H: I was told that they lived on the block.
I: I went back to get my camera and take a few pictures of the chickens and the beginning of the artwork.
J: I finished taking the pictures and they were ready for me to start helping.
K: I found a paint roller and chose to start with painting the yellow rays of sunlight.
L: It took a couple hours but it looked great.
M: I had wanted to paint a part of the mural that I could come back and say, I did that.
N: I decided to paint the manatee.
O: It had already been drawn so I got the grey paint mixed and started to paint it.
P: A young girl, who was visiting the neighborhood, asked to help paint.
Q: I directed her to where there were more paint brushes and she soon came back.
R: It was a fun time painting the manatee.
S: The outline of the manatee looked really bad at this point, so I got some black paint and went over the entire outline having to change some of what we had previously painted.
T: When I was finished with the outline, it looked great and everyone was really happy with it.
U: I then took a picture of it and went home happily knowing that there was a manatee painted on that street by me.
context.149:
A: Three months ago I lost a job that paid minimum wage.
B: It was barely enough income to get by on and not enough for my budget to include savings.
C: That's how I found myself homeless.
D: Within a matter of a few months, I was consigned to wander through the streets that used to be mine.
E: I now sleep in the same park where once I stood looking lovingly at the green earth, the trees, the birds sweetly fluttering.
F: That park is now a place to hide away from the rest of the world, so like a leper.
G: It seems just yesterday that I'd belonged with those people who come for the fresh open space.
H:  My eyes now  follow their peaceful smiles, their kids full of crisp laughter as they casually walk about the grounds.
I: They're spending a pleasant holiday hours just seizing a chance to drift and dream.
J: That's very different than being me who is now a drifter who never dreams anymore.
K:  Much of the time I stay huddled far back into the rich foliage, under old blankets and plastic.
L: I've ceased dreaming and now know only the nightmare of little to no food, warmth, or affection, and all I can feel is fear.
M: I don't understand why this happened to me.
N: I didn't do anything wrong; I just lost my job.
O: Several losses followed-- my apartment, belongings, my pets, even my friends.
P: I hold onto my faith fiercely hoping a miracle might come along.
context.150:
A: A few weeks ago, I went to dinner with my boyfriend and my best friend.
B:  I'd known my best friend since we were pre teens, and this was the first time they had met.
C:  It went really well! I'd been dating him for nearly a year, and it'd taken quite some time for our schedules to line up.
D: I think this delay in meeting gave me some pent up anxiety about it finally happening.
E: My friend texted me asking if I'd like to get dinner, and I let her know that I was with my boyfriend at the time.
F:  We got burgers and wings at a place nearby.
G:  The food was great, but the company was better.
H:  We ended up seeing a couple people that my friend and I knew.
I:  When we finished eating, we spent some time speaking to them.
J: It was nice to catch up with old friends.
K: Afterwards, we went back to my friends house, where my boyfriend fell in love with her dog.
L: Seeing them interact was adorable, since my dog is a senior and doesn't quite play as much.
M:  It was great to spend time with two people I value and care about, and to see them getting along so well.
N: I'm looking forward to spending more time with the two of them in the future.
context.151:
A: I've always loved taking picture.
B: As a teenager, you never saw me without my Nikon.
C: I was always in the photo lab at school.
D: Even in my senior photo, I've got a camera around my neck.
E: Becoming a professional photographer was a life long dream for me.
F: Working at the photo mart in the mall in high school was my launch into my career.
G: When I got hired onto the newspaper, I was extatic.
H: But getting my first portrait published into a national magazine was a huge milestone.
I: To see MY picture.
J: Right there on the cover.
K: I could never have imagined it.
L: But there it was, my picture on the cover of Time Magazine.
M: My name in the credits of Time freaking magazine! The sky is the limit.
N: The last three months since my picture appeared, I've been getting calls from all around the world.
O: The future is bright.
context.152:
A: So after i found out that i would ne welcoming another little one into my life i wasn't sure how to feel.
B: I was happy,sad,scared and unsure all in one.
C: I would be starting over yet again.
D: It was like i was becoming a new parent.
E: What makes thing scary is doing it alone.
F: My main support system was gone.
G: The grandmother to my children was no more.
H: Every time id became a parent,my mom was there by my sidem welcoming my little one with open arms.
I: The one i needed when no one else was there .
J: was gone.
K: This will be extremely hard.
L: I know that I will cherish these moments as if she were here.
M: I know that she is watching us from heaven.
N: Protecting us as we live our lives.
O: It doesn't make 9t easier though.
P: My new baby will never meet you.
context.153:
A: I had to fight with how awful the computer program was.
B: There was one quiz where it was not really relevant to my job and i could not figure it out.
C: You only had three times to pass (and the questions changed) before you had to request a reset.
D: I used my three attempt and could not figure out how to request a reset.
E: My store does not really have new employees so my boss had no idea how to reset it either.
F: I had to call and basically do my own research before figuring it out.
G: That took a couple days.
H:  Eventually with the pressure on I came in for a saturday to just finish this once and for all.
I: I thought I would be there for 2 hours.
J: I ended up being there for 6 hours.
K: I passed though.
L: Now I am fully involved in work and dont feel like my job is threatened.
M: I can just relax.
N: It is a great feeling.
O: In the end I would say it was worth it.
context.154:
A: My cousins organized a family reunion this June.
B: It was held at the home of my cousin Denise's former husband.
C:  To get there, my partner and I had to travel from our home in the Bronx to Manhattan.
D: We did this by subway.
E: Then we had to take a bus to New Jersey.
F: First, we planned on taking a bus that we did not realize does not run frequently on the weekend.
G: We decided to take the other bus, the one recommended by the host of the party.
H: We missed that bus by a few minutes.
I: When we finally got on the bus, we ran into one of the worst traffic jams I have ever encountered.
J: It took us hours to get to the party.
K: What did turn out nicely was our food contribution.
L: My cousin Charlotte, who lives in Massachusetts, had mentioned in passing that she loves coconut flan.
M: Therefore, I made that to bring to the reunion.
N: We did not tell her that that's what we were bringing.
O: It came out really well, and she loved did, as did her Cuban-born husband.
P: I felt the whole long boring trip was worth the effort when I saw how happy it made her that I had thought of her and made one of her favorite dishes.
context.155:
A: My son, we will call him Sam, decided to play football.
B:  Now, Sam is a bit on the husky side, but that is truly his only downfall.
C:  He is incredibly smart and gives all tasks his all.
D:  He is super friendly, and kind of Ferdinand in that he doesn't like using his size to hurt others.
E:  He also is home schooled, because as a parent, I am worried about bullying and the other social factors that cause students to become sidetracked from their studies and lead to emotional problems.
F:  In any event, when Sam began playing football, he began with a group of kids that already had been playing together for years and also went to school together and lived in the same neighborhood.
G:  He had made some friends, but this core group of kids was hard to crack - especially since Sam had no previous football experience AND the coaches were all father's of this golden crew.
H: Sam was having an especially tough practice, and was confused about the instruction of a particular play - and finally angry because on day 7 Sam didn't know what in the heck a touch back, left tackle was or the different rules that apply to offense and defense yet.
I:  The coaches son said some incredibly hateful things to Sam behind his back, but loudly enough  so that Sam could hear.
J:  He was crying and so upset when all of those kids laughed and picked on him all practice.
K:  I briefly spoke to the coach who did NOTHING but say it was FOOTBALL and to toughen up.
L:  I talked to Sam, and he decided to stay.
M:  He seemed a little off that day, but worked hard and had all the plays figured out as he had studied up the night before.
N:  When it came time to scrimmage the other 3rd and 4th grade team, they SHOULD have demolished them,  but since Sam was a left tackle and his job was to protect the punk that had been treating him like crap - he decided to literally, and VERY obviously step aside and allowed the 150 lb beast of a defensive linebacker attack the little jerk.
O:  After taking a couple of hits, Nate, the snot nosed coach's son, started hollering at Sam to do his job.
P:  Sam called a time out and very loudly said, "I tell you what, Nate.
Q:  I'll make you a deal - you stop talking smack about me and treating me like dirt, and I will do my job.
R:  Does it seem really smart to be mean to the one person protecting you from a monster sized kid with death in his eyes?  Do you think it makes sense to piss off someone twice your size?  So what do you think?  Are you ready to be nice, or do I need to keep leaving a hole?"  The whole field was silent - and the kid was so red.
S:  His mother gasped.
T:  I was SO SO proud, of Sam - and then someone started clapping, and then everyone joined in.
U:  He handled it like a champ - and since then - there have been no squabbles on that field!
context.156:
A: The most unexpected thing happened to me about 3 months ago.
B:  I've been so busy since then that I'm just now writing about it.
C:  I'm such a procrastinator!  My best friend and I were on our way to see my favorite band, Highly Suspect, perform at the Amphitheater when I heard my phone ringing from the depths of my purse.
D:  I almost didn't answer it because I was driving and all that, but my best friend fished it out of the abyss for me.
E:  I am SO glad I took the call!  It was an automated call from the local rock station I listen to religiously on my way to and from work, telling me I had won a trip to Las Vegas.
F:  They have a web page where you can enter-for-a-chance-to-win stuff like T-shirts, concert tickets and vacations (obviously).
G:  I had totally forgotten about it because I never win anything, even though I check the page daily for new contests.
H:  I was so excited when I got that call, having never been to Las Vegas, that I immediately called the radio station.
I:  I almost thought it wasn't real.
J:  The lady who answered the phone assured me that if I had gotten the automated call I had definitely won the trip.
K:  She got real quiet and said she needed to check something, so she put me on hold.
L:  When she came back on the line it was with the most awesome, unexpected news!  I had actually won a trip to Mexico.
M:  This excited me even more, because I've always wanted to go to Mexico.
N:  It was the most amazing trip and I will forever remember it!
context.157:
A: A family member needed help doing a birthday party.
B: I ended up helping.
C: The decor was already bought.
D: Mainly, the help needed was to just put up all the decor.
E: It involved many ladders and tape.
F: We got it done in time and it looked good.
G: Many of us didn't like the chosen decor but it wasn't our call.
H: Overall everyone helped a lot and we had a blast.
I: When the cake was brought out, everyone noticed the crazy candles and how the flame was quite big.
J: The candles needed to be blown out quickly so they wouldn't burn the cake.
K: All of them were melting quite fast.
L: I think is was because they were so close together.
M: The candles were luckily blown out in time.
N: Nothing bad happened.
O: Good food and friends.
context.158:
A: Two months ago my boyfriend and my best friend met for the first time.
B:  We had been dating for 7 months at the time, but had known each other for nearly a year.
C:  This particular friend is probably my closest female friend.
D:  We share a lot about our love lives, even though we don't see each other super often.
E:  She knows that I'd been really happy in my relationship and was eager to meet him.
F:  It finally so happened that schedules aligned and we were able to meet up.
G:  I was a little nervous at first.
H:  I wasn't worried that she wouldn't approve or anything, but it's always a little bit of an unsure situation introducing people you're dating to old friends.
I: We met at the restaurant, a local burger joint/bar.
J:  The three of us had a great time! Conversation was easy, and as expected, they got along wonderfully.
K:  Some mutual friends showed up at the restaurant, and we had a brief conversation with them before heading to her house.
L:  Once there, we spent a while playing with my friend's dog.
M:  My boyfriend made fast friends, and it was really sweet seeing him interact with her dog.
N:  Overall, we had a wonderful time, and I'm sure that my significant other made a good lasting impression on a very important friend of mine.
context.159:
A: Around seven months ago, I was out with friends celebrating my birthday.
B:  It was a fun night overall of catching up and enjoying ourselves.
C:  By the end of the night we find ourselves stopping at Target because a friend needed something out of there.
D:  Everyone else wanted some sort of refreshments so they agreed to stop as well.
E:  So we go in the store and basically split off from one large group.
F:  I find myself heading towards electronics as usual to browse.
G:  A bit after I'm browsing, I realize I need something near sporting goods.
H:  I stop in an isle and I hear a voice call my name.
I:  I froze, caught up in a whirlwind of tons of emotions because I recognized that voice.
J:  It was my ex girlfriend that I'd known for over a decade.
K:  She looked different, like the happiness had been sucked out of her.
L:  She looked tired, really tired and I wondered how she'd been.
M:  She didn't explode with excitement or even move.
N:  Quizzically, she just said my name again.
O:  I greeted her and we embraced.
P:  We hugged for what seemed like 10 minutes and then we finally broke apart and began to catch up.
Q:  I tried to keep everything casual but on the inside I felt a bit bad for her and missed her.
R:  She told me about some of the rougher things that were going on and caught me up on what she had been doing.
S:  By the end of it all, I couldn't help but to feel a bit bad but I was happy to have seen her.
T:  We promised to keep in touch and then parted ways again.
context.160:
A: This story was about me spending time with two separate friends.
B: The first friend I spent time with at her birthday dinner at a korean BBQ place, the second friend I spent time with at her house to watch a movie.
C: Dinner at the BBQ place was super fun and I was most surprised to see a soju tower on the house when I showed up.
D: It was a huge tower-like container that has a switch and when you open it, soju just comes flowing out.
E: The price of it was more than $30 so I was really surprised to see the restaurant just gave it to us on the house.
F: I was also surprised by how many people showed up.
G: I hadn't checked who else was coming and I was pleasantly surprised to see some friends I hadn't seen in a while.
H: This dinner was significant to me because my friend was turning 21, an age that is pretty important to a lot of teens.
I: It wasn't as important to me, but it was to my friend because she is quite a heavy drinker, so that made it important to me too.
J: I had a really good time during the dinner.
K: I was anxious at first because I wasn't sure where I would be sitting.
L: Since my friend invited a lot of people I knew it was pretty guaranteed I wouldn't be able to sit with her.
M: But I ended up finding a lot of people I knew and had a good time catching up with them.
N: Afterwards I met up wit my other friend to watch a movie.
O: This event was significant to me as well because I hadn't seen this friend in a while, and I got to see the new place she moved out to.
P: It was the first time she was finally living on her own, and it was nice to see her slowly going into adulthood more.
Q: I had a really good experience writing this because it made me feel all these happy feelings I felt when I was going to the party and to my friend's house.

context.161:
A: About three weeks ago I witnessed something scary.
B: I was taking a walk in the park with a friend.
C: The weather was gorgeous and the park was quiet, only some children with their parents playing around, and some people walking about and taking advantage of the beautiful day.
D: Then a kind of rumbling noise started.
E: It morphed rapidly into something more akin to a shrieking noise, with an explosive component somewhere in.
F: And it got louder and louder, to the point where it seemed to fill the air around us completely.
G: Of course everyone in the park started looking around to see where the noise came from.
H: And it became quickly obvious that it came from the sky.
I: Six jets, clearly war planes of some kind, flew over us, almost as fast as arrows.
J: They were flying in V formation like geese - dark, deadly, shrieking metal geese.
K: They flew toward the river, and beyond, leaving everybody shaken, overwhelmed and very surprised.
L: Why would they fly like that over a peaceful city like ours? Where were they going? And what were they going to do out there? In that instant, I didn't feel scared for myself or my community, but I felt horrified by the sheer amount of brute force and power displayed.
M: I thought of people living in cities being bombed by similar planes, the horror of it, and the powerlessness of those people.
N: And for the first time, I physically felt what war is, I felt it in my bones, its monstrosity, and what it did to people.
context.162:
A: The event was a concert.

K: They say i did not win? But sure enough, I was the winner.
L: It was a 4 day 3 night free trip with airfare to Las Vegas.
M: Both me and my spouse love Vegas.
N: We enjoy the people watching, lights, hot weather, and gambling (even though we never win).
O: I could not believe it.
P: I was so excited to have won this.
Q: I even joke to my spouse that this was the greatest day of my life.
R: I usually get the side eye from that.
S: I am always reminded about the birth of our children, wedding, and engagement proposal.
T: Either way it was a great night, and a great trip a few weeks later.
context.163:

I: I told my son to keep in touch with me as much as possible, and I worry that he won't contact me as much as I want! I realize that he is an adult now so it is just something that I have to accept.

K: That will always be a precious memory in my mind.
L: Thinking of it helps me remember our strong relationship.

N: My son will be fine!
context.164:
A: I had just finished my degree in Character Animation, and I was ready to celebrate with my family.

D: My parents rented a car, and drove out from California to Utah.
E: When we arrived into town, we checked into a hotel located on the river.
F: The hotel was next to a bus system that could take us into town, and then into the national park.
G: The bus was helpful, since the weather was overcast and rainy.
H: Due to the rain, we had less of a selection of trails, but we still made the most of the trip.
I: After we unpacked all of our things, we went into town to shop and explore the area.
J: We ate at one of the restaurants, got a trail guide, and explored a few of the shops.
K: The next day we took the bus to the trails at Zion National park.
L: We hiked along beautiful trails with waterfalls, plant life, and animals.
M: My favorite trails went right up to the waterfalls.
N: We also visited the nature center, and learned about the wildlife and history of the park.
O: After hiking, we went back into town and relaxed.
P: We brought snacks back to our room and talked about our day.

context.166:
A: Oh yeah this story haha.
B: Okay so I was traveling across the country to create a life with the love of my life in a state I never lived in.
C: Big jump! I wasn't gonna leave my son (Rocky the Turtle) behind.
D: Can't drive so, hopefully airplane security will be cool with a turtle.
E: He's a real charmer, so while TSA was skeptical when I first explained the situation, the moment the box opened and Rockso went to say hi to this new exciting person, they were captivated.
F: Got to skip the x ray imagers, but they still had to swab him down for potential explosives.
G: Or drugs? I guess he's just that HOT looking haha.
H: But really.
I: They swabbed him down, found nothing of course, and then we were off to wait for the airplane.
J: Rocky was NOT a fan of the box by the way.
K: He would shuffle around and try to dig his way into the paper towels I laid down for the trip whenever the box was closed.
L: When it was open, however, he'd chill and peek his lil turtley head up and out, taking in the sights.
M: He got to meet several curious travelers including one delighted lil toddler whose mother was v charmed by my personable lil guy.
N: This was only between planes, however.
O: Could not open the box and take him out midflight.
P: Seemed risky, didn't want him getting loose and causing a panic, or even worse, getting hurt.
Q: He was tucked under the seat in front of me the entire flight, and all you could hear was occasional little flurries of scrapes as he tried to burrow his way out of the box to freedom.
context.167:
A: This was a charity event that a charity in my town puts on every spring.
B: We provide beginner gardens for low income people so they can grow their own vegetables.
C: We give them dirt and plants and seeds to get started.
D: We even provide containers for them if they don't have a yard to plant in.
E: The local gardeners and high school career center students grow tomato and pepper plants and donate them to the event for the people to use to start their gardens.
F: I volunteer at this every year.
G: It's fun to see how excited the children are to be able to pick plants that they want.
H: It makes me feel good because I think what we're doing is showing them another way to feed themselves that's healthy and cheap.
I: The lady that runs it says we're helping the next generation rise out of poverty by giving them the skills to do different things that can better their lives, like growing healthy food.
J: Maybe when they get older they'll be healthier and continue to grow their gardens and even pass the tradition down to their kids.
K: At this year's garden giveaway they had a Big Seed contest.
L: The charity gives the seeds to the local schools who give them to the students.
M: Each year it's a different seed.
N: The students are encouraged to grow the plant at home (this year it was watermelon) and bring it to the Garden Giveaway and enter it in a contest for biggest plant.
O: My favorite part of the giveaway this year was the look on the little boy's face who won for biggest plant! He was so proud.
P: It's moments like that that touch me the most.
Q: How easy it is to make a child feel special and proud of themselves.
context.168:
A: I had been sick,throwing up for the past few days and very tired.
B: I haden't a clue what the problem could be.
C: I was a bit nervous.
D: After much thought I went ahead and purchased a pregnancy test and took it.
E: Anxiously waiting for the results  my whole world was rocked.
F: It had been 13 years since I was told that I'd never be able to have another child.
G: I was completely confused,terrified,shocked,amazed &a thousand other things.
H: But this time would be much different.
I: I would be all alone.
J: My mother was gone.
K: Due to stage 4 cancer, I'd lost her just 6 months prior.
L: She was my rock.
M: Was this her way of giving me the light at the end of the tunnel so to speak.
N: Only time would tell how this would turn out.
O: Would I be strong enough to do this without her? Or would I just fall apart completely.
context.169:
A: My mother  had been living in a nursing home.
B:  She had fallen at home and broke her wrist.
C:  She was hospitalized.
D:  They put a splint on her.
E:  They were afraid that due to her age, she was not strong enough and that caused her to fall.
F:  They felt physical therapy would be beneficial to her.
G:  She went from there to a 21 day physical rehab center.
H:  They were unable to improve her strength or balance.
I:  They felt that a nursing home was the onlhy choice for her to be safe.
J:  Rehab was provided 3 times a day there.
K:  She never regained her strength and died there in the last 90 days or so.
L: I was devasted because I had really hoped she would come.
M:  I kept encouraging her.
N:  She continued to work as hard as was possible at the time.
O:  During  her time there, though, I was relieved because I knew she was safe.
context.170:
A: Last month, my brother came to visit me for his birthday.
B: I live in a large city, so I invited him because I thought there would be a lot of fun things to do.
C: The day that he arrived, I went to pick him up from the train station around 9 am.
D: His train was a little late, but luckily it wasn't too long of a delay.
E: After he dropped his stuff off at my apartment, we went to get lunch and went to the ferris wheel that overlooks part of the city.
F: Later that day, we went to China town where we ate dinner.
G: The next day was my brother's actual birthday.
H: We left my apartment around noon and got a quick lunch at a vegetarian restaurant.
I: After that, we got on the bus to go to the planetarium.
J: We had a lot of fun looking around the planetarium and watching the show they had about a possible ninth planet.
K: After we left, we got back on the bus to go back to my apartment.
L: We changed clothes and got ready to go to the restaurant where we made reservations for his birthday dinner.
M: We were going to take the train, but when we got to the station we saw the line we needed wasn't running, so we had to walk.
N: We were almost late, but we power walked so we could make it on time.
O: We had a nice dinner, but when we left it was pouring rain.
P: When we got back to my apartment, we had birthday dessert and went to bed because we were both tired.
Q: Overall, it was a really fun weekend and I was glad I could spend it with my brother.
context.171:
A: Three months ago a trail of events happened that was really awful for me and my family.

D: The doctors really didn't think she could live safely at home.
E: Shortly after she died in the nursing home.
F: It was the day we got the whole family together to visit her.
G: I am really devastated about this all happening so fast.
H: I still feel like I should be able to contact her anytime.
I: I sometimes wonder if I just speak into the sky if she will hear me.
J: I really should know better.
K: I have never believed in that stuff.
L: My family has been really supportive of one another.
M: I am really glad they are all able to lean on each other.
N: I am happy I have my boyfriend and my son to help me keep my mind off of it.
O: I just don't know if I will ever stop grieving.
context.172:
A: I know it may sound silly but it was quite emotional to finish what I now consider to be my favorite book.
B:  It is difficult to even come up with a single favorite book but I did in this case.
C: I liked it so much , maybe because at 59, I am aging and related well to the characters.
D:  I am also a Texan.
E:  Lonesome Dove is about two aging ex-Texas Rangers that feel the need to have one last great adventure.
F:  This last adventure takes the form of a cattle drive from south Texas north to Montana (if memory serves me well).
G:  There are many other characters involved with different backgrounds that could very well have books of their own.
H:  The adventures abound and there really isn't a dull moment in the entire book.
I:  Larry McMurtry excels at character development to the point that I felt as though I knew them.
J:  He also excels at plots and sub-plots that are very compelling.
K: While it isn't "War and Peace" long, it is a rather long book but I wished it was longer when I finished it.
L:  I was very sad when I finished reading Lonesome Dove.
M:  It was like losing a playmate, maybe even a friend.
N:  I wondered what I was going to do for reading next.
O:  I ended up researching similar books written by Larry McMurtry.
P:  I did find other similar books that were written about the western United State at around the same time period but it just didn't match the colorful characters in Lonesome Dove.
Q: Maybe it was because I was born in the panhandle of Texas, my dad was a real cowboy and I could relate better to many of the things mentioned in the book.
R:  As such the others paled in comparison.
context.173:
A: It went really well and you could tell the low income people were really happy here.
B: A lot of them were just really intrigued by the whole process of growing a garden.
C: I really have to say it intrigued me too.
D: I think its nice to come together with people who you assume are different than you are, and realize that no, its not that way at all.
E: You also find out you like similar things.
F: They are low income people, and I even hate that term now, they are just people to me now, and I am just glad we were able to help them.
G: I think it was just something that needed to happen for me to wake up a little bit.
H: Now I really want to do as much as I can to help people, either similar to me or just not in a good spot, like I am for now.
I: This also let me know that I might not always be in good spot, and that there are people out there who could and want to help me.
J: Besides the important thing of helping people who needed it, the whole garden part about it was really nice as well.
K: Now that I know more about that, and how it can bring people together, I am really intrigued by it.
L: Its something that is a process, but at the same time it is also peaceful.
M: I think that is a hobby when it comes to gardening that is something I am going to look into.
N: It made those people happy, and it did me as well.
O:  This was something that I am just glad I got to experience with people who really ended up making me happy in the end as well.
P: I look forward to helping more when I can.
context.174:

E: My cousin looked gorgeous and everything was set to go.

I:  We called my Aunt to come in and she immediately had me take off the dress.
J: She cleaned up the stain somehow.
K: After that, she held the dress under a dryer.

M: After that, we walked down the aisle and no one could tell! The wedding went on without a hitch.

O: It was great to see my cousin so happy.
P: I enjoyed celebrating with her and had a great time.
context.175:
A: 4 months ago I had the most amazing experience of my life.
B: I decided to take a few weeks off from work and just reconnect with myself and nature.
C: A friend had suggested I go to Alaska, it was far away and desolate, it sounded perfect.
D: After much research I wound up agreeing to go dog mushing around the interior of Alaska with a native of the area.
E: I was nervous for sure, but it sounded like the chance of a lifetime.
F: I needed to break from reality badly.
G: I had been working 7 days a week for months and felt like my brain was about to explode.
H: After a few days of riding around the lonely outskirts of Alaska I really started to feel better.
I: I stopped thinking about work.
J: My mind totally cleared and for the first time in forever I really felt at peace.
K: The scenery in Alaska is amazing.
L: It is hard to explain.
M: It is so plain and vacant, but is is beautiful.
N: It looks untouched, like no one has been around to destroy it like the rest of the world.
O: My favorite moment of the entire trip was when we took a short break to let the dogs rest.
P: I was sitting in the snow and I looked over and saw 2 moose walking across the ice.
Q: I had never seen a moose up close, it was breathtaking.
R: They are bigger than a car.

context.178:

context.179:
A: My heart is utterly broken.
B: Two months ago in May, my sister-in-law passed away.
C: It was sudden and very tragic.
D: She was driving home from work in the rain when she lost control of her car and get into an accident on the interstate.
E: It feels like I was just talking to her and planning our next get together.
F: We'd planned to go to a concert with my brother and sister in July.
G: I didn't like the artist that we were going see, but it was for her birthday that we'd missed doing something for in February.
H: She had been waiting to go that concert for years but hadn't been able to because our work schedules didn't line up.
I: I considered my sister-in-law as much one of my actual siblings as my brother and sister are.
J: She'd been there for my wife and I through some hard times and was always willing to lend a hand to help us with the children.
K: I can't believe that she's gone and I know that it's tougher on my wife.
L: This is a very tragic time for both of our families, because she was really a light in our lives.
M: My family is pulling through as best we can and are making sure that we are there for each other in this trying time.
N: The funeral was difficult, but it was attended by so many people and my sister-in-law would've really been happy to know how many lives she touched when she was still here.
O: I think that if anything good can come out of this is that we'll be more of a bonded family.
P: We know that's what she would've wanted us to do and we'll honor her in this way.
Q: But I don't think I'll ever stop missing her.
context.180:
A: I really loved being able to get together and learn more about art.

D: It was my first time to pain on a street and the first time to paint a ten foot manatee.
E: We chose the manatee because it is the elementary school's mascot.
F: It was also a great way to get the kids involved.
G: I learned about how to paint on the street and make sure it isn't easily washed out.
H: This was a really great experience for me because I paint often.
I: I am no master artist or anything but I think this experience has given me a huge burst of inspiration.
J: I do not think I will start creating graffiti or anything but I might start using different tools.
K: My choice paint is watercolor because of how delicate it is and soft and beautiful the strokes come out.
L: It takes patience because what appears when you paint, and what comes out when it dries are two different images.
M: What I love about painting the street is that it is easy to just make corrections immediately without having to wait much.
N: This was a great experience that opened my eyes to new things.
O: I think I may try using acrylics next time I am in front of the canvas.
context.181:
A: About three months ago after a long ongoing search, I found something of value to me.
B: This was the home of my dreams! I had done it, I had gone through all of the things I needed to do to get to this point in life, too.
C: I made myself proud and others as well.
D: It was a long and gruelly process but sometimes the things that take the longest to transpire are worth the wait.
E: One of the most interesting things that happened during the search was the most memorable ever for me.
F: This was when I met my long time friend from years ago again.
G: His name is Pete.
H: Somehow we lost contact.
I: He and I went to High School together, when we met again he told me about a house that was up for sale after meeting him again in a grocery store.
J: He only lived about two blocks away.
K: Since then we have gotten together a few more times and plan to date again.
L: Now I can truly say I am happy with what I have chosen, and this house will be mine to live in for the rest of my life.
M: Not only that but I have rekindled a good friendship that might turn out to be something more.
N:  This is what intriques me about life in general.
context.182:
A: When I look back on the night my son graduated from college, I am overcome with pride and love.
B: I can precisely picture everything about my surroundings that night.
C: I am usually not that great at taking everything in and focus on small details in my life and at events as opposed to the big picture.
D: This night, however, I can clearly recall the view across the room, the colors, the sounds, the whole entirety of it all, and most importantly, the feelings.
E: I know I could go back to that huge room and find the seat I was sitting in among thousands just based on the clarity of my memory.
F: I took everything in.
G: Before the graduation, I had trouble finding parking and rushed into the venue at the last moment, worried I wouldn't be able to find a seat.
H: I found one way up high with pretty poor view because none of the lower ones were available.
I: At that point, I had no idea where my son was, no idea if I would even be able to see him or not.
J: He texted me as the commencement started and told me where he was.
K: Based on that, I was a little upset because I had definitely chosen the opposite side of the arena from him and was very far away.
L: In spite of that, I absorbed the whole ceremony and kept one eye always fixed on his head, small as an ant.
M: The whole time, I balanced between crying with pride and joy and smiling so hard that my cheeks and jaw hurt.
N: In the end, my bad seating location turned out to be central to the single most memorable moment of the night.
O: As the graduates were being released by row to leave the room, I saw that I was sitting directly over the exit that they were filing out through.
P: Everyone around me was standing and I'm not that tall, so as he approached the exit, I got on my toes as high as I could and raised my arm so he could hopefully see me.
Q: With about 30 feet to go before he passed under me, he looked up and directly at me and we locked eyes.
R: I will never forget the look he had on his face.
S: It was so almost too special to be described...a combination of pride, joy, thankfulness, humility.
T: Words don't do justice to that little moment we shared.
U: Mother and son loving, knowing and understanding each other without words.
context.183:
A: We recently attended the funeral of one of my co-workers.
B: After some very unexpected health problems he passed away.
C: Still a young man with a young family, very sad and tragic.

G: His favorite sports team was the Tampa Bay Buc's and it was suggested, not required, that those who wanted to could wear their jerseys to the memorial service.
H: Probably close to two hundred friends, family and co-workers showed up at various times to show support to his wife and celebrate his shorter than expected life.
I: There were many in attendance wearing his favorite teams jersey though not all.
J: They all mingled together talking about the shortness of his life and shock of being loss so young.
K: There were tears and laughter of times when he had been and encouragement to different attendees he had worked with.
L: It was a gloomy day, cloudy day outside with rain on an off.
M: However, the crowd inside didn't match the outside gloom as though sad, they were celebratory and thankful for having known him as friend.
N: We meet many we hadn't seen in sometime and all we happy to see us though not under the circumstances we came for.
O: A speaker toward the end told of the young man's life while a video played in the background showing him in happier times.
P: When he had finished we went forward and gave his wife a hug and expressed our shock and surprise at his death.
Q: We've seen her and the kids once since his passing and they are getting along.
R: They miss him of course but it's one of those things in life that we encounter sometimes.
S: Unexpected bumps in the road that you have to deal with and move on.
T: He'll forever be in our thoughts and remind us to be thankful for those in our lives that our still with us.
U: Good reminder to spend time with our love ones and acknowledge them while they are here.
V: You never know when life will throw one of those bumps in your path.

context.190:
A: This Summer I went on a month long trip out West.

H:  My visit was everything I have always imagined and more! My family and I saw American Bison, prairie dogs, Big Horn Sheep, and so many birds! One of the most exciting moments was when my children were able to get very close to a prairie dog for a picture! The sun was so hot that day, but there was a nice breeze over the prairie.

context.191:

G: Right away I knew it was bad.
H: I spent a few minutes writhing around in pain before being helped off the court.
I: I was forced to sit on the bench and ice my knee while the final minutes ticked away.
J: Unfortunately we did not have the size on our bench to replace my height, and it cost us the chance for the championship.
K: The final score was 85-84, and we ended up leaving with a second place trophy.

context.192:

context.193:

context.195:
A: My event of choice happened a few months ago.
B:  My wife had been having back spasm issues from time to time.
C:  We tried to get state medicaid to cover home care for the problem, but they required her to go to a doctor, which she was not able to do with her condition.
D:  Finally, the problem got so severe that she had a major back spasm that would not relent.
E:  As we had no car, I had to call 911 to get an ambulance to take her to the ER.
F:  There, they verified it was a back spasm related to her herniated disc.
G:  It was an emotionally difficult time for us all.
H:  She was under great pain, so much that she could not speak.
I:  I had to maintain my stress level, as I have high blood pressure, and call to get her treated.
J:  Then, we were told that she would STILL have to go to her PCP to get treatment, but at least they gave her enough pain meds to get her there.
K:  Over the weeks that would follow, there would be many, many consultation visits, scans, and lab works.
L:  It was not easy, but they did finally get her on good meds, a back shot, and therapy...back at the ER that would not allowed to treat us at the start without all of this run around.
M:  The event and following weeks put much financial and emotional strain on us.
N:  It disrupted our ability to earn money, as we had increased bills.
O:  However, it is good to know what the problem was.
P:  Only recently have things approximated the old days.

context.199:

context.200:

F:  It all started six months prior when I saw a family friend that I hadn't seen in awhile.
G:  As soon as I saw him, my heart started pounding.
H:  My stomach dropped to the floor and, of course, I had to pee right away.
I:  All of the bad memories assaulted my mind in a matter of seconds.
J:  The way he had sexually assaulted me those many years ago.
K:  All of a sudden, it seemed like it had happened just seconds before.

M:  I wet myself and left in quite a hurry.
N:  It was positively humiliating to me but I'm pretty sure no one else noticed because I left so quickly.
O:  So now, it's a common problem.

Q:  I thought maybe it would stop after a few times but it seems to be going strong 6 months later and I'm at my wits end as to what to do.
