context.201:
A: I always knew my boyfriend was a liar.

context.204:
A: I recently came to the realization that most of what I believed in life was a lie.
B: No one "lied" to me, but the American Dream, at least for myself, was filled with untruths.
C: The idea, of course, if that if you go to college, get married, have kids, buy a house...etc, that you will experience a life full of joy.
D: A short time ago though I realized that this was not the life for me.
E: Of course I realized this too late.
F: I already have a wife, kids, house and lots of college debt.
G: I now spend my days working to pay interest to the same people who probably made up the story on how to be happy.
H: So, in need of some relief, I traveled to south Florida to see an old friend.
I: We talked - for hours - about the true meaning of life, its purpose, and what to do when you are unhappy.
J: Some people say that if you are not happy in life, change it.
K: Find another job.
L: Move.
M: However, if you are already in the society trap of the American Dream, escape is not so easy.
N: Well, at least not if you have a conscious.
O: There is a scene in the movie "Office Space" that really strikes home.
P: In a moment of clarity, Peter, the main character, tell his psychologist that each day he wakes up is the worst day of his life.
Q: I feel him.
R: My memorable event was not something that happened "to me," but an awakening inside me.
S: I now find myself thinking about this each day, planning how I might change things, trying to find the courage to become the person I want to be, to live the life I have always wanted.
T: Too bad I have been living the life others told me would make me happy.

J: There were many candles on the cake, because they looked good on the type of cake that I had bought.
K: We lit the candles, and soon the candles erupted into a large flame.
L: The flames had joined each other into sort of a bonfire like appearance.
M: It was funny but somewhat dangerous.
N: My family member had to blow them out quickly before the whole cake burned up! My family enjoyed the party.
context.208:
A: I traveled cross country with my turtle, via airplane.
B: It was a great move across the entire country, I was basically uprooting my entire life and replanting in a brand new state.
C: So, of course, I had to bring my turtley son along with.
D: I put him into a shoebox with some airholes and a towel to keep him comfy.
E: He wasn't happy about his travel arrangements, though, and kept trying to dig his way out.
F: Poor guy.
G: Sorry lil buddy.
H: He did get to meet the TSA, who allowed him to bypass the x ray machine.
I: (I was worried about health effects for my boy!) But they had to check his box, and insisted on swabbing it for explosives.
J: Or maybe drugs? They found none, of course, except the ADDICTIVE AND EXPLOSIVELY CUTE personality of my turt.
K: He charmed the TSA instantly and though they finished swabbing within a minute, they spent five or six cooing over my boy.
L: Once in the terminal, he continued to charm my fellow passengers, and got a lot of pets.
M: The rest of the trip was less eventful.
N: He'd attempt to burrow his way out every once in a while, but I let him peek out whenever I was sitting between flights, and the new sights and smells seemed to satisfy some curiosity.
O: It was only when the box was closed that he tried to dig his way to freedom.
P: Once we got to our new home, he sulked in a corner of his tank for a week.
Q: But he quickly returned to his good natured, turtley self once he realized there was a whole new world to explore now just outside! This is going to be his home for years to come.
R: He's hopefully never going to have to travel by plane again, and I think he's more than okay with that.
context.209:
A: A big chunk of my family attended the ELO concert in Atlanta on July 5th of this year.
B:  I come from a very large family (I'm the youngest of 7) and there were 10 of us total who attended the concert.
C:  It was an awesome show and I would rate it as one of the top 6 or 7 concerts I have ever attended - and I have attended a LOT.
D:  It was so enriching to spend time with my siblings because we don't get to do that often enough.
E: This event was also memorable for one other reason.
F:  My brother bought the tickets last December when they first went on sale.
G:  He bought enough for everyone, including my oldest brother's wife.
H:  She was so excited - she had never seen ELO live.
I:  Unfortunately, something tragic happened just 6 weeks before the concert.
J:  She was outside in her garden and she had a massive aneurysm.
K:  She was rushed to the hospital but it was too late.
L:  She passed away that night.
M:  We lost someone very special and dear to our hearts and the pain was palpable.
N:  My oldest brother decided he didn't want to go to the concert after she passed away.
O:  He said it just didn't feel right.
P:  After numerous conversations, we convinced him to go.
Q:  His oldest son took her place.
R:  It was an emotional evening while we were at the concert but it was exactly what our family needed.
S:  We miss her terribly - and we will always miss her terribly - and the concert was dedicated to her.
context.210:
A: A couple summers ago my family and I took a trip to the Smoky Mountains.
B:  We had been hiking a lot over the past few months and decided to tackle Mt.
C: Leconte via Alum Trail.
D:  It's an 11 mile round trip hike with a 16.53 trail rating which is considered strenuous.
E:  We started of on our hike with myself, my sister, brother, husband, daughter, niece and brother in law.
F:  My brother in law was the first to stop as it was uphill most of the way.
G:  My daughter who has had knee surgery was next to go down and my husband stayed back with her.
H:  We ended up only going to he top of the Alum Cave trail because it was another 5.5 miles to the top and we couldn't not in good conciense make our hiking companions wait on us to complete the entire hike.
I:  Fast foward two years later.
J:  We have again made a trip to the Smokies and are determined to make it to the top.
K:  My hiking companions this time are the same minus my daughter.
L:  We had not been hiking as much this year and are not in as good a shape as we were on our last attempt.
M:  The path is much more strenuous this time and by the time we make it to Alum cave we are wiped but determined to continue.
N:  We are already down one hiking companion, my brother in law, but he told us to go on without him.
O:  As we continue myself, niece and husband pull away from my sister and brother.
P:  As they continue it becomes to strenous for my brother and he has to abandon the hike.
Q:  My sister ends up catching up with us as I have really slowed down as it is a straight up hike now.
R:  We are all struggling but are dertemined to make it to the top.
S:  As we round the last bend in the trail and see the top we are overjoyed!  We made it!  At the top is a lodge and we deicde to go in the gift shop and purchase a shirt to proudly display our accomplishment.
T:  As we head down we meet up with my brother first who was not faring well he had run out of water.
U:  We share our water and continue down.
V:   As we near the bottom we see my brother in law waiting for us.
W:  We have decided to return in a couple years and see if we can all make it to the top.
context.211:
A: In March of 2019 I went to the doctor to get my blood pressure medicine refilled.
B: The doctor also did was blood work.
C: When the results returned the doctor saw I had a high PSA count.
D: It was 12.
E: 391 and for a man my age it should have been less than 4.
F: After a biopsy, the doctor informed me that I have prostate cancer.
G: Then the doctor informed me that for my age surgery would be the best way to treat my cancer.
H: I decided to go ahead with the surgery and have my prostate removed.
I: I had prostate surgery on Aug.
J: 20, 2019 and had my prostate removed.
K: I have a return appointment on October 8, 2019 to check my PSA levels.
L: Hopefully everything will fine.
M: If all is good I will have my PSA levels checked every 3 months for the first year.
N: Then every 6 months for a couple years.
O: If all is good then the doctor will check my PSA levels once a year there after.
P: This was an unexpected life event for me!
context.212:
A: This was a while ago now.
B: I may not remember as many details.
C: The wedding took place on a farm that belonged to my cousin's father-in-law.
D: Since there were no trees around, it was nice and quiet and quite beautiful.
E: It was very hot, and the reception being held in a nearby metal barn didn't help either.
F: The bathrooms were in a trailer that was air conditioned, so that was nice.
G: I was able to see family from Chicago, England, LA, and other places I don't normally get to see.
H: It was fun watching my dad have to squirm while he interacted with brothers he doesn't particularly care for.
I: They had an issue with food running out, so my aunt had to call a local pizza place for an emergency order.
J: In the end it all worked out.
K: The ceremony was nice, and my cousin looked beautiful in her dress.
L: I felt like I was sweating too much due to the heat, and the pictures I'm in I don't look too good in.
M: In an odd turn of events, I never actually got to speak to her husband, even though we were in a picture together.
N: But I understand they were very busy that day and had a lot of guests to interact with.
O: Overall I had a very good time at the wedding.
context.213:
A: Last March I went to a tax accountant.
B: I needed to file amended returns for the Patreon income from four previous years.
C: I'd been under the impression since I set up my Patreon account that it was gift income, and therefore non-taxable.
D: But gradually it became my primary source of income and I shifted to self-employment as a freelance writer.
E: And the more I looked into it the more I began to suspect it was taxable after all.
F: I feared getting into serious trouble.
G: In July of last year I concluded that it was indeed taxable.
H: So I made plans to see an accountant and file for back taxes.
I: According to my research on Google the IRS was required to allow installment payments I could afford, but I was still quite apprehensive in the months leading up to the meeting.
J: In March I met with the accountant, gave him documentation of the additional income, and paid him $400 for preparing four years' amended returns.
K: This was considerably cheaper than my worst-case estimate, and was in itself a significant relief.
L: And he confirmed my information about making installment payments.
M: In the months since, the IRS sent me a bill for back taxes and I arranged a modest $64/month installment payment.
N: I also subtract 15% self-employment tax.
O: It's a total tax burden I'm able to bear relatively easily, and a great load off my mind.
context.214:
A: I work for Walmart, a company I have been working for the past 3 years.
B: Two weeks ago, I got a promotion.
C: This promotion I had been waiting and hoping for, for the last year.
D: I was finally promoted to Assistant Manager.
E: It was an unexpected early promotion as I was not supposed to get promoted until September, instead I got promoted in July.
F: It really came to a surprise to me that I got the promotion so early.
G: I suppose it was because they really enjoy my line of work and love that I am work-driven and know how to complete tasks in a timely fashion and can be consistent and meet deadlines.
H: At least, I hope that is why they decided to give the promotion to me as early as they did.
I: I am very pleased with my work ethic, I enjoy this company a lot and think that I can bring new and fresh ideas to this company as well as be a great manager.
J: I just didn't think that it would happen because even though I work so hard and I want to do a great job and make sure that I am always on time and I am always striving to be a better version of myself from the day before.
K: I like to do well in the goals and tasks that I have set for myself on a daily basis when it comes to my job, or anything that I do.
L: I am very grateful for this opportunity to be in this new position and so grateful to my employers above me that felt that I deserved this opportunity and are wanting me to progress and grow along side the company.
M: I have put so much time and effort into this place and it's starting to pay off.
N: I know that if I put in the amount of hours, work, and dedication that I can achieve anything and for that I am so proud and honor to be apart of this establishment.
O: I am over the moon about this promotion and I ended up celebrating with my loved ones and family members with a bottle of bubbly berry juice (as I and my family members are not a fan of alcoholic beverages) and we went out to dinner afterwards to celebrate this new chapter of my life.
context.215:
A: After the birth of my granddaughter, I was happy.
B: Blissfully unaware, I enjoyed the prospect of having a new infant in the family to love and spoil as only a grandmother can.
C: That happiness was short-lived, however, when CPS became involved in the baby's life because of events that had happened in her mother's history.
D: I was shocked to find that she had things in her history that were so terrible that CPS felt the need to investigate and eventually remove the children from her care.
E: This threw the family into chaos.
F: Three months ago, things really changed.
G: My son had to move in with my husband and I.
H: My infant granddaughter also moved in.
I: Now that she's here, I find myself raising her on my own.
J: I love her dearly and want nothing but the best for her, but it is hard.
K: This poor innocent child now has to suffer the consequences of her parents' actions.
L: Why is it that the good among us always find suffering at the hands of those who choose to do badly?  I want to believe people can change, and I want to believe that someday my son and his family can care for her needs, but I am unsure.
M: This has been one of the hardest times in my life.
N: Although it has been so difficult, my sole focus is on this beautiful child and making sure she has the love, care, and attention that all innocent children deserve.
context.216:
A: My family and I work with a charity to deliver food to the homeless one weekend a month.
B: One Saturday a few months ago, our truck run was scheduled for the day before Easter.
C: I wanted to do something special for the homeless.
D: I made a few suggestions to my family.
E: My moody teenager daughter soundly rejected each idea and then went upstairs.
F: She didn't return downstairs.
G: I assumed she just didn't want to do anything.
H: A little while later though, she came downstairs with an idea.
I: She suggested we fill plastic eggs with chocolates and deliver them with food to the homeless.
J: So I went out and bought the supplies.
K: My family and I all filled the eggs with candy.
L: On Saturday, my daughter watched as the homeless individual's opened their plastic eggs.
M: I remember that she became teary eyed as she saw the delight on the homeless people's faces as they found the chocolates.
N: She didn't want us to see, but we did.
O: I was very proud of her.
context.217:
A: Two days ago my son was harassed at football practice by some of his teammates.
B:  He is an incredibly good player, good student, and is well-liked.
C:  However, some kids have taken affront to the fact that he is an all around good kid and good guy.
D:  They are jealous of his popularity and his alleged perfection.
E:   Before practice 4 kids circled him up and pushed him around while taunting him with emotionally scarring words that effected his game play during practice.
F:  He didn't want to turn the kids in because he felt that that would cause more problems, but he did choose to share his concerns with me -as a way to vent.
G:  He and I went for a long run to get it out of our systems.
H:   I couldn't sleep that night, I was angry at the kids and upset for my son.
I:  Even though he said he was ok, I knew that he wasn't and I could see the hurt and frustration in his eyes.
J:  The next day, I called the coach and took it upon myself to report the situation.
K:  He was surprised because everyone likes my son, and was concerned that he opted not to say anything to him about it.
L:  The coach wound up looking at the security footage from the field for that day, and though he couldn't hear what was being said, he was able to determine who it was, and what was happening.
M:  He showed the whole team the footage at practice the next day.
N:   The entire team -except those kids of course - voted to have the brats kicked off the team for bullying and harassment.
O:  They were also suspended from school for their behavior.
P:  I know it was wrong, but I couldn't help but feel a little pleasure in the how this was handled.
context.218:
A: About 6 months ago, I decided to learn more about the art of food foraging and how it could be beneficial to me.
B: I started by searching the internet for anything I could find.
C: I was surprised at how much you could learn and how complex it could be but I didn't let it scare me; I continued in my quest to learn more.
D: I was intrigued by just how many wild foods there were out there available for us to eat.
E: It made me realize that people aren't using the natural resources we have and that there are a lot of things that are going to waste just because we don't know it's available to us.
F: After a week of doing extensive research, I decided to go on a hunt and see exactly what I could find.
G: I drove about an hour away to a location that was plentiful of forest and wildlife that I thought would suit me for my foraging needs.
H: As I walked through the woods, I stumbled upon things I had not recognized from my research, so I had to use my best judgement about whether or not this was something that could be edible.
I: I found a patch of wild berries that looked good so I decided to try my luck and eat one.
J: They were very sweet and did not have a bitter taste, so I ate a few more before continuing on my way.
K: Further on my travels, I saw some wild plants so I decided to pick them and take them home with me to see what I could do with them.
L: This was turning out to be quite the interesting adventure.
M: I heard a rustling noise behind me so I abruptly looked over my shoulder and realized that I had entered someone else's territory.
N: Instead of seeing a person like I expected, I saw a beautiful deer standing behind me.
O: It didn't run away like I thought, but just looked at me inquisitively, stopped to take in the sights and smells of nature, and then slowly walked away.
P: At that moment, I thought to myself, people and animals aren't all that different.
Q: We are all here for the same reason; survival and to try and protect what is ours.
R: As it started getting dark, I figured it was time to pack up and take my findings home.
S: My stomach was feeling a little bit queasy and I was hoping it wasn't the berries I ate from earlier!
context.219:
A: The worst day of my life is when I lost one of my best friends my grandpa.
B: He was so close to me.
C: I always used to share all kind of stories with him.
D: I used to share my happiness and sadness with him.
E: He was the best person to share all type of difficulties because he had so much experience so he would guide you through the right directions for sure.
F: The day he passed away I was out of town for some business purpose and that was the first time that I was leaving him for about two weeks or so.
G: However, when I left him, he was perfectly fine and was healthy as well.
H: He had no health issues whatsoever.
I: I was so impressed with his diet and the style that he lived his life.
J: In addition to that, I called him couple times while I was away but suddenly, he had a heart attack and my family took him to the Emergency.
K: He fought with his life in ICU for couple hours before he died.
L: As soon as I found out about this, I went straight to the airport, but the flights were delayed for couple hours due to incremental weather.
M: However, I took the first flight and went straight to the hospital, but it was too late.
N: I could not meet him in his last time.
O: I still regret about this and perhaps will never forgive myself and will never forget that incident.
context.220:
A: I’ve always liked doing something charitable, and that Easter was just another time to give to those in need.
B: I’ve been trying to raise my kids with the same values that were instilled in me, so four months ago, I brought my daughter along for our charity food truck run.	We were just going to drop off some canned goods and a few baked goods my wife baked, but my daughter took it one step further.
C: She wanted to get some plastic eggs and fill them with Easter candy to hand out along with the food.
D: Bless her heart.
E: I know people say that teenagers only care for themselves, but she’s such a good girl.	So, we did exactly that.
F: On the way to the shelter, we picked up some eggs and candy, only a few dozen or so.
G: We sat right in the back of the truck and individually placed candy in each egg.
H: We grabbed a couple of baskets, plopped the eggs in, and drove on over.	I couldn’t believe the affect that such a simple, inexpensive gesture would have on these folks.
I: I know they’re usually grateful when we drop off food, especially around the holidays, but this little extra something special really drove it home for them; people truly do care about each other.
J: Even she wept at seeing how it made them feel.	I couldn’t thank my daughter enough for reminding me of this lesson, something so simple that I truly forgot it.
K: It took the little bit of compassion from a teenager to remind me why I do these kinds of things.
L: And they say teenagers only care about themselves… She’s a good egg.
context.221:
A: The memorable event that I shared was when my step-father got in touch with me after a long time of us not speaking to each other.
B: My biological dad left when I was a baby so my step-dad was pretty much the sole father figure in my life during some of my formative years (around age four to nine).
C: This was until he and my mom unfortunately got divorced.
D: He still tried to be there for me but life got in the way.
E: He and I drifted apart over time.
F: So my step-dad apparently got my phone number from my mom and gave me an unexpected call one day several months ago.
G: I said how good it was to hear from him, and we updated each other on some of the new mundane things in our lives.
H: He also told me about his health, which he's had issues with at times, but on the whole things are going pretty well for him especially considering he's in his 70s.
I: I shared news about my own health which has also had some bumps in the road.
J: He told me he has a new wife who he said is great and he's very happy being with.
K: The memorable and rather shocking part of the story was when that my step-dad told me his younger sister had died (only in her 50s) far too soon from cancer.
L: I was really quite sad and taken aback by this.
M: It brought up a lot of memories from my childhood of staying over at her house and how nice she was.
N: I of course tried my best to offer my condolences and sympathy.
O: It was a nice conversation and moving experience that lasted about half an hour.
P: At the end of the call we expressed intent to stay in touch, which we have.
Q: It's been good to have him back in my life even in just a small way.
context.222:
A: Today was the day! After nine long months of waiting to meet my daughter, I got to hold my baby girl in my arms today.
B:  I was so scared to go through another c-section.
C:  At least this time it was planned and not an emergency.
D:  The spinal block was awful, I thought I was going to be sick.
E:  I'm so tired but I'll never be able to sleep.
F:  I can't get enough of that beautiful little face.
G:  I'm worried about how her brother is going to handle having a baby in the house.
H:  He didn't seem to be too happy when he met her.
I:  It could be because I'm not home too, change is always hard for a toddler.
J:  I knew he wasn't going to be thrilled, but he actually bit her head.
K:  Not even 24 hours old and she already has a sibling injury.
L:  I thought he was going to kiss her, but I was mistaken.
M:  I'm going to have to make sure he gets enough attention.
N:  My heart is so full.
O:  I think being a mom is probably the best thing in the world.
P:   I am worried about how hard it will be to have two little ones but I guess it will come with time.
context.223:
A: Recently, I visited Zion National Part with my parents.
B: It was an exciting trip, since I just graduated from college.
C: It was also the first family trip we took with the three of us in months, so it was fun to be just with them.
D: I really enjoyed the trails and exploring the landscape of the national park.
E: I was a bit out of shape, so some of the trails were difficult, but I felt happy once I completed them.
F: My favorite walks on the trail were the paths that lead to waterfalls and hanging gardens.
G: There were beautiful rock formations, and amazing plant life.
H: Also, the bus ride up to the trails was fascinating, especially seeing the variety of different locations.
I: After our days in the park, we headed into town to check out the shops.
J: A lot of the shops were rock and mineral shops.
K: There were some nice rocks, but I didn't end up purchasing any.
L: There were also lots of outdoor stores that had a wide range of supplies.
M: I got a hat and a water bottle as a souvenir.
N: We also went to some local restaurants and had some snacks and drinks.
O: Overall, the trip was very fun and memorable.
context.224:
A: Today I found out that my wife is going forward with a divorce.
B: I still can't believe that she is going to do it.
C: I feel like the past two years of focusing on reconciliation, was for nothing.
D: I also don't believe that she is thinking of the kids.
E: Having parents that were divorced and growing up in that environment, is the last thing I wanted for the kids.
F: I don't think that my wife realizes how this is going to impact the kids.
G: I am so sad, frustrated and upset by all,of this.
H: All I wanted was to restore our family.
I: I miss my wife.
J: I miss being with the kids everyday.
K: I miss us being a family.
L: I continue to pray for healing and restoration, but I'm losing hope.
M: I know God is in control, but I am struggling.
N: I think about when the tragedy that struck our family just over 2 years ago and never thought it would result in our family separating.
O: All I can do is focus on God and be strong for the kids and let them know that we are still a family.
context.225:
A: I am progressing smoothly.
B: It is now my sixth month, and I'm heading into the 3rd trimester.
C: The first was rough.
D: I had a lot of morning sickness and fatigue.
E: I'm 33, so my body isn't too young anymore.
F: However, the second trimester was way better.
G: I have a lot more energy, and feel almost normal.
H: I actually was able to take my son on a little vacation to NYC a couple of weeks ago.
I: We had a blast.
J: He is very excited about the pregnancy too, as he is an only child.
K: Although he was hoping for a boy, and we found out we're having a girl.
L: Either way though, it's a blessing.
M: I really never planned on having anymore children, although I thought about maybe adopting.
N: I am very driven and focused on building a career though.
O: So I just didn't think that this would be feasible.
P: I have an amazing partner who is such a great help though.
Q: He's not only stepped up for household duties, but also as a father figure to my son.
R: I couldn't be any happier with how my life is currently going.
S: It's amazing how everything just works out as it's supposed to.
T: I never would've dreamt it would be possible to have it all, but here I am living beyond my wildest dreams!
context.226:
A: My brother was getting married.
B: I went to attend his wedding.
C: The wedding was being held several hours from where I lived.
D: I carpooled there with the brother of my brother's wife.
E: We arrived at the wedding.
F: It was the day before so I helped set up some things.
G: They had rented out an entire resort with cabins for all the guests.
H: It was in a  beautiful location.
I: The wedding happened the next day and it was lovely.
J: The weather was very nice the whole time.
K: The food was also very good.
L: I served as a best man, so I was involved in the wedding ceremony itself.
M: After the wedding ceremony, there was live music and people danced and drank beer, wine, and other beverages.
N: When it got late, I retired to the cabin I was staying in.
O: The next day I drove back home.
P: It was a lot of fun.
Q: I felt very happy for my brother and his wife.
context.227:
A: I had a miscarriage 8 months ago.
B: It happened on February 12th 2019.
C: I was eight weeks pregnant, so barely there, but enough to know and to feel some symptoms.
D: I found out really early (5 weeks) because my period is like clockwork.
E: Well...used to be.
F: It was at the time.
G: The craziest part of the whole experience was actually passing the fetus.
H: The pain was some of the worst in my life, and i've been though some other shit in the past.
I: I felt and saw it - it was kinda like something big going through me and then it was all over me.
J: The size of my hand, literally.
K: I was able to pick it up, move it, etc.
L: Once the fetus came out, the pain reduced a lot, although it was still painful.
M: It's crazy to think about even now.
N: It still feels like yesterday sometimes.
O: My life will never be the same.
context.228:
A: Earlier this year my aunt  was diagnosed with cancer for the fourth time.
B: She had asked me to be the executor of her trust so we spent a lot of time together going over important details and how to handle things after her death.
C: We expected her to live a lot longer, but she died suddenly and not from the cancer.
D: She was in the middle of her treatments, going for radiation and chemo, her hair was starting to fall out and she shaved her head.
E: My son and I would visit her every couple of weeks just to check in and keep tabs on her, and see if she needed anything.
F: She lived with her grandson, who is 23.
G: He was struggling with this as both of his parents were really horrible and his grandmother was really the only stable person he had in his life.
H: One day I get a call that Auntie had a stroke.
I: She went into surgery, but it didn't appear she would really recover from this.
J: We went to visit her a few times in the hospital.
K: My mother was there every day as she the medical decision making power.
L: She was not going to come back and be herself.
M: She was breathing on her own however she didn't respond to us really.
N: She would look around and turn toward a voice, but otherwise she didn't really respond.
O: She had a dnr and she had told us she didn't want extraordinary measures taken.
P: So the decision was made to let her go.
Q: It was sad that she died this way, and so soon.
R: We surely didn't expect it this quickly, and certainly not from a stroke.
S: I then had to take over as executor of her trust which wasn't an easy task, and I had to inform people of her death and post on Facebook for her.
context.229:
A: Five months ago I was still mourning and healing from the abrupt death of my mother who died late last year.
B: She was my best friend.
C: She was married to my father for 42 years and he was heartbroken over her death.
D: Five months ago he died from that broken heart.
E: I was the classic daddy’s girl.
F: I was  such an emotional wreck over their deaths that I went into auto pilot.
G: I was dealing with funeral, insurance companies and estate issues and was just going through the motions.
H: I signed so much paperwork it all looked the same.
I: It was just a part of the process.
J: My parents loved me dearly and spoiled me greatly.
K: They always took care of me, even as an adult.
L: Exactly 3 weeks after his death I started receiving settlement checks in the mail from a lawsuit he had just finished.
M: It turns out that my father was awarded settlements from a lawsuit at the time of his death.
N: As the executor of his estate the funds went to me.
O: I was floored.
P: The 12 checks were made out to me and had my father as reference.
Q: I immediately called the law firm and was explained that I had already signed the release and they had all that they needed.
R: In  my autopilot state I signed all of the paperwork without even realizing it.
S: And that was just the first round of checks.
T:  My parents found a way to take care of me even in their death.
context.230:
A: My daughter was born on December 4th.
B:  It was a planned c-section after a high risk pregnancy.
C:  I was very excited to meet my new little girl but it was bittersweet.
D:  This was my last pregnancy and although I was a tough one, I already knew I was going to miss the little details of carrying a child.
E:  The small flutters that reminded you of the sweet baby in your belly, the wonder of seeing their kicks and movements, and the little gestures of kindness that are reserved for pregnant women were all things that I would never experience again.
F:  I was also scared for the procedure.
G:  With my first child, I had an emergency c-section so I didn't have time to stress about the whole surgery.
H:  This time was different.
I:  I worried about the things that could go wrong,  I didn't have the same confidence in my medical team that I had had with my first child.
J:  I think my biggest concern was how my son was going to handle having a baby sister.
K:  He was barely two.
L:  I didn't know if he was going to be upset.
M:  I was worried that he wouldn't feel loved and wanted.
N:  When my husband brought him to my hospital room, I wanted him to feel just as important as he always had.
O:  My son looked a bit alarmed at all the hospital equipment.
P:   My husband brought him over to see the baby and he showed a bit of interest.
Q:  He stroked her hair and said "baby".
R: That's when he leaned over to kiss the  baby on her head.
S:  The whole room sighed at the cuteness of it.
T:  Until the baby started screaming, that is.
U:  Apparently, he was not as taken with his new little sister as we had hoped.
V:  She had two tiny red marks on her forehead from where he bit her.
W:  I had expected him to be unsure of the new baby but I never expected him to do that.
X:  He then asked us to "take her back, please".
Y:  I think that was the beginning of a lifelong sibling rivalry.
context.231:
A: In May, my best friend graduated from medical school.
B: We had gone to different colleges and different graduate programs so we rarely saw each other in person, maybe once or twice a year.
C: We were from the same hometown but neither of us had lived there for over half a decade.
D: I wanted to attend her graduation but it coincided with my younger brother's high school graduation so I couldn't go.
E: She did invite me to her graduation party though.
F: The party was a pretty big deal.
G: My friend is African and when they party, they really party.
H: Her relatives had flown in from Cameroon just for this party.
I: There must have been at least one hundred people there.
J: I got to catch up with some other classmates from high school who I hadn't seen in a while too.
K: After we had eaten, my friend and her family made speeches to the room.
L: My friend, as the guest of honor, had the spotlight speech.
M: Unexpectedly, she talked about me in her speech and my own accomplishments.
N: She told a room full of people about proud she was of me.
O: I had no idea beforehand she was going to say this.
P: I wasn't really sure what to do in the moment.
Q: But I did feel extremely grateful that I was important enough to her to be singled out among all the other guests.
R: It really reinforced the bond we've had for over ten years.
S: I hope that ten years from now, we will still support and uplift each other like this.
context.232:
A: We had a family reunion about 4 months ago that was a really great time.
B: I got to see my distant family that I hadn't seen in decades since I was a kid and close ones that I rarely see.
C: It was cool to see my grandpa because It's honestly been at least 25 years and since he is handicap it's hard for him to get around.
D: He also lives on the opposite coast so it is just hard to meet up.
E: He was looking in pretty good health about the same as when he left so that was good to see considering all the time that has passed.
F: My grandma was there too I had my issues in the past with her but it was still nice to see her.
G: She treated my mom poorly so we don't talk much but I put aside my issues just for this small time period to make the gathering go smooth.
H: I got to see my favorite aunt and uncle who both shared similar passions to me with computers and tech stuff and it's been like 20 years since I saw them so that was sweet.
I: Basically they are the same as I remember just older but they are just as into tech stuff as they were back then.
J: I remember I would bring my GameBoy or old PC games over to their house and they would know about them or have them themselves.
K: Just really good memories honesty that I was happy to remember with how stressful life has been.
L: Finally I got to just catch up with some other family members like my cousins and some others who I didn't remember as well cause I was so young back then.
M: This might have been the last time a lot of us get to meet because we all live so far apart and aren't exactly wealthy so we tried to make the most of it.
N: We took a lot of pictures and overall had a great time and we pledged to try and talk over the phone/webcam more often.
O: I hope everyone gets to meet up with their family at some point because in the end it's all that you have and you don't want to waste that.
context.233:
A: About a month ago, my first son began crawling.
B: It was an awesome experience to watch him learn how to move on his own.
C: To be able to put him down and let him do his own thing was a welcome experience after several months of carrying him everywhere.
D: I love to watch him explore his world and interact with things.
E: He is growing so fast and I am so proud of every little accomplishment he achieves.
F: I enjoy watching him play with the cat and the dog.
G: We have had to move a lot of things to higher places that he cannot reach.
H: I had to redo my home theatre system because he kept pushing buttons that I did not want him to press.
I: I am willing to do the extra work around the house so that he has a safe and functional environment to play and learn in.
J: I am lucky enough to work from home so I get to be around him all the time.
K: It is great to be able to spend so much time with him and help him learn and develop his skills.
L: I look forward to the day that he takes his next step and begins to walk.
M: That experience will present its own challenges and I look forward to facing those with him.
N: Every time his independence increases and his reliance on me decreases I feel like my experience as a parent gets better.
O: I love being with him and his personality shines as his abilities increase.
P: I can't wait to see the person that he becomes.
context.234:
A: A couple of weeks ago, there was a rumor that my co-worker, John had passed away.
B:  He was so very liked by many people.
C:  His down to earth and jovial personality will certainly be missed.
D:  The rumor was confirmed to us by his wife and family and everyone at worked was sad to hear the news.
E:  We did get together and reminisce about all the good time we had together; including giving him grief about his beloved sports team.
F: We got news of the funeral.
G:  It was not too surprising to hear that the funeral will be informal.
H:  In fact, we heard that we would be encourage to wear jerseys of his favorite sports team.
I:  This took some of us by surprise.
J: We wanted to show a formal amount of respect.
K:  But I guess this is the way he wanted it.
L:  It was nice to see everyone show up wearing sport jersey.
M:  Not everyone joined in on the informal attire.
N:  I think they felt uncomfortably overdressed.
O:  Ha ha ha, John was probably laughing in the casket! The ceremony was nice.
P:  We all paid our respects during the ceremony and at the grave site.
Q:  Afterwards we were all invited to a reception at a local sports bar.
R:  Here, we all told our stories of John and the experiences we had with him.
S:  Although there was much laughter, there was also some somber moments.
T:  I for one will remember all the good times I had with John.
U:  I will miss him dearly.
V: The following week at work, a number of us talked about Johns service.
W:  We filled in some people who were unable to attend.
X:  Our management decided to have one day a month where we could wear our sports jerseys.
context.235:
A: I have been her friend since high school.
B: Not only did we happen to attend the same church, we also share the same birth month.
C: I didn't know until it was our last year in high school.
D: We share so much in common.
E: Different career path and our family background made us attend different college although it was against our wish.
F: We had planned to attend the same college and even study the same course.
G: Fast forward to four years in college, it was her graduation party.
H: I attended the party with one of our other friends as she was someone we loved so much and very proud of.
I: Her relatives from Germany were also in attendance.
J: I knew it was set to be a glamorous graduation party.
K: I thought she was just going to give a vote of thanks when she picked up the mic.
L: It was more than what I thought as she started talking about her ordeal in college and how she scaled through.
M: She started by thanking God and her parents, the school, faculty and friends.
N: As she mentioned friends, I was happy she has finally recognized us as part of his college journey.
O: I didn't expect it when she mentioned how I have been a source of inspiration to her and about how I have been hardwired with the will to go on.
P: I was moved to tears while she talked about me.
Q: It was an overwhelming and inspirational experience for me and it made me realize who I am and what I am made of.
context.236:
A: A memorable event that happened to me within the past few months was being contacted by my step-father.
B: After he and my mother got divorced when I was a kid we very gradually drifted apart and had less and less contact until he was only calling on my birthday.
C: Then some time in my 20s even that stopped, and for several years we had no contact at all.
D: Recently he called me out of the blue.
E: We had a long conversation and reconnected.
F: It felt really good to be able to bond with my step-father again.
G: I was glad to find out that he's in good health despite being in his 70s.
H: We generally were able to catch up on each other's lives.
I: He's still working as a substitute teacher from time to time, and I told him I'm working at a restaurant.
J: An unfortunate thing I found out while talking to him was that his younger sister passed away from cancer.
K: It was very sad to hear this as I remember her well from my childhood.
L: I also know they were very close to one another so I tried to console him the best that I could.
M: Overall this was a very significant and emotionally moving event for me that I still think about from time to time.
N: We've since talked a couple more times.
O: I'm optimistic it will lead to more of a relationship in the future.
context.237:
A: When I began getting my Patreon income, I assumed it was gift income.
B: So I assumed I didn't have to worry about taxes on it.
C: But as time wore on and the amount of the income increased, I began to worry.
D: It was becoming the majority of my income.
E: And eventually I quit my wage job and it became my main source of income.
F: So I continued to worry that it was taxable.
G: As I researched it, in 2018 it seemed more and more likely that it was taxable.
H: I was worried about the amount of past income I might owe back taxes on.
I: So I went to a tax accountant in early 2019.
J: It turned out that I owed about 6k in back taxes for the previous four years.
K: It was fairly easy to make monthly installment arrangements that I could afford.
L: And my monthly income was within the personal exemption amount.
M: This meant I only had to pay 15% self-employment tax.
N: So my worst fears weren't realized.
O: I could survive the payments I had to make.
context.238:
A: Today my first grandchild was born into the world.
B:  It is a happy but also a sad day.
C:  My grandchild is a girl and that is happy.
D: She is healthy and that is happy.
E:  However, her mother is what brings the sadness.
F:  My son's girlfriend is a possible prostitute.
G:  She is a known drug user.
H:  She has no job and has tattoos all over her body.
I:  She is twenty two years old and already has two children from previous relationships.
J:  The youngest of which she does not even know for certain who the father is.
K:  Another sad thing is that she has child protective services involved with the two boys and now this girl.
L:  She got high and her two year old was out wandering the streets alone.
M:  The police were called and found her passed out on the sofa.
N:  Now, they are involved with this baby.
O:  My granddaughter, son, and his girlfriend are having to move in with me and my husband.
P:  We have to sign papers that we will watch the child and not allow her mother around her unsupervised.
Q:  Basically I now have to raise my grandchild as my own child.
context.239:
A: I always feel like I am not in the moment.
B: I feel like I'm living my days like a robot and not connecting with anyone.
C: It's like a lightbulb went off and I realized what all I'm missing out on.
D: I've been going through the motions of the day and going about my life like a schedule.
E: Now, that I finally see what I've been doing I know what I have to change.
F: It means no more living on auto pilot and loving the same way.
G: I realize how I need to take the extra time to show my kids how much I love them and not just expect them to just know.
H: I realize I need to change up the monotonous everyday and show them by actually saying it more out loud and not expecting them to know because I do the standard things everyday that they've come to expect of me.
I: Everyone needs to truly feel and understand that they're loved which I've realized can't be done on the same monotonous auto pilot mode.
J: It's time to go outside of the norm and truly show it.
K: I have literally changed my everyday life from a simple realization.
L: By actually showing my love and speaking my truth it has made not only my children much happier and more willing to talk openly to me about what's going on in their lives, but it's also made me so much happier.
M: Living on auto pilot happens way to often and I feel like I can't be the only one in the same boat.
N: I feel like my advice when talking with friends and family has really had a positive impact on them as well.
O: It's sad that we forget, so often, that our loved ones should just see our love just because we do the things we are required to do to care for one another.
P: It is not only myself living on auto pilot but me putting my kids on auto pilot and I had to make a change.
Q: I'm so thankful I did because it's made my relationship with my children a much more positive one.

labels.0: ['I was out and about on my day off, when by complete chance I got a craving for a candy bar.', 'I decided that I deserved a treat and so I went to my local grocery store.', "Since I was there, I got a couple more necessities so I wouldn't have to go later on in the week.", 'It was then, in the flour aisle, where I ran into her.', 'However, she looked strikingly similar to my mother.', "It wasn't actually my mom (obviously) but she looked similar enough where I had to go talk to her.", "She was a very interesting woman, and surprisingly, she wasn't taken aback by anything I said.", 'I told her that I thought she might be related to me.', "I told her my own name, my mother's name, and even some extended family's names.", "I apologized profusely for my mistake, but she wasn't upset at all.", 'We decided to grab a donut and a coffee and chat.', 'It turned out that we actually had quite a bit in common.']
labels.1: ['I am a professional photographer and recently reached a big milestone as a photographer.', 'I had my first portrait published in a magazine.', 'The portrait that was published was a portrait of my child, which made it even more special.', 'I messaged my husband to tell him the news!', 'I also messaged some family members and they were also very happy to hear the news.', "I ordered a copy of the magazine and couldn't wait for it to come in.", 'I showed it to my child and they were also very excited to see their portrait in the magazine.']
labels.2: ['After years of saving and waiting I was finally ready to buy my first home.', 'I ended up putting an offer in on the house and the sellers accepted.']
labels.3: ['It was a sunny Alaskan day in the brooks range.', 'I saddled up 12 dogs and headed out on a training run.', 'I decided to take A break at one of my favorite spots where the trail meets the river.', 'As I looked out to my amazement I saw a baby moose struggling through the snow.', 'A minute later I spotted the mom moose not far behind.', 'Next, I heard a strange sound I hadn’t heard before.', 'As I looked out I saw something trotting through the woods, not far from the moose.', 'To my surprise it was a lynx.', 'I noticed another lynx not far behind the first one, it was an amazing sight.', 'Before the dogs noticed I gave the call and we took off.']
labels.4: ['My son is now much more mobile and active than he was when I last wrote about this.', 'He is walking around (while holding onto things) and climbing all over everything.', 'He is opening cabinets and drawers and taking things out to play with them.', 'His personality is even more apparent and he is able to process and display more complex thoughts and emotions.', 'We are much more social with each other now.', 'talking and playing have a lot more significance now.', 'He has grown so much in the last few months.', 'It is clear that at this stage, his growth is faster than it has ever been.', 'Enough time has passed that I am beginning to miss when he was smaller because of the simplicity we had in our lives, but I love watching him learn and grow up.']
labels.5: ['My cousin told me my mom is coming to town next week.', 'She asked me was I going to let her see the kids.', 'Of course when i said no I was made out to be the bad guy again.']
labels.6: ['I was on my daily game of Dota 2 last week and I had a very intense two hour game that is both stressful yet rewarding.', 'I picked Crystal Maiden as my hero and I went with another person who played a carry Slark at the bottom lane.', 'My lane partner was very vocal on the team chat on how I am very inefficient and was stealing his experience points in the game.', "He did say something about how 'noob' I am and grew more and more frustrated minute by minute.", 'He was killed multiple times in the early game and of course, I was blamed for it.', "Even though I had a mic, I stayed quiet and just typed 'I'm sorry' on chat whenever he screamed at me.", 'Our towers are down but I kept optimistic on winning.', 'The first time the enemy made a mistake and we won a team fight, I immediately congratulated our team for the great play and my other teammates were all audibly optimistic as well.', 'Our carry Slark at this point has considerably limited his verbal abuse and I was sure that he will cooperate once he realized we were all there to win the game.', 'The enemy had many more mistakes after that and we had a very satisfying comeback.', 'I was surprised that he did commend me back and got a friend request from him after the game.', "I did accept his friend requests and we've been playing a few more games to this day."]
labels.7: ['A little over 3 months ago I discovered that I was unexpectedly pregnant.', "I have a son who just turned 12, and since I'm in my 30's I figured I was done.", 'About 6 months ago I started dating a coworker, who is a great man.', "I'd even told him not to expect me to have kids if he wanted to be with me.", 'Then after just 2 months I found out I was pregnant.', "After some months to get used to it, I can honestly say I'm very excited now though."]
labels.8: ['today we took our son to college.', 'we helped him arrange his apartment.', 'we took him to the store to get stocked up on groceries.', 'it is going to take me a while to recover, especially when i go into his room.', 'i will probably call him tonight!']
labels.9: ['This summer was very hard for me me and my boyfriend broke up.', 'I have been so depressed i couldnt even very out of bed i just been hating myself.', 'Ive gotten down to thoght about taking my own life.', 'My boyfriend cheated on me with me with one of my friends just becuase he saw her on facebook.', 'I can blame anyone but myself my mom once told me before she left that no one is going to love me like my family is going to love me.', 'I would like to sing i often write my own songs in hope of freedom.', 'These days i just feel like smashing my head threw a wall becuase i am just being consumed by overwheling revaltions about this world and who i ama.']
labels.10: ['We decided to renew our vows in front of family and friends.', 'We invited friends and family from all over the country to join us for dinner and dancing.']
labels.11: ['I recently had surgery for my knee injury.', 'Surgery went well, but the doctor found the injury was worse than expected.', 'I had to have addition repairs done to my knee.', 'It also turns out the recovery is way longer than expected.', 'I was told by the doctor I would be walking again a few days after the procedure.', 'It turns out that this will be a 3-6 months recovery process.', 'Right now now I am going on about 2 months.', "I still can't fully bend my knee back past 90 degrees.", 'And I still experience a lot of pain.', 'I am required to wear a knee brace all the time.', 'But the brace is pretty uncomfortable and itchy so I take a break every chance I get.', 'I am in physical therapy two time a week, and it does help.']
labels.12: ['I finished a book I have been reading for the last few days.', 'I really miss this book -- it seemed like an old friend.']
labels.13: ['It was our first trip to Colorado since I was a very young child and the first overall with my new family.', 'My wife and daughter had never been to the Rocky Mountains either, so it was sure to be a treat.', "We stayed with my wife's cousin and were there primarily to visit my wife's aunt.", 'She has very sick and moved from Chicago to Boulder in order to live a more comfortable life.', 'The first full day were were in Colorado we were taken to the Rocky Mountain National Park.', 'Unlike the typical park in a city setting, this was a huge, and I mean huge area, covering a vast majority of the Rocky Mountain range.', "My wife's aunt was able to come with, using her scooter, so it was nice spending our day with her also.", "She had only been to the lower portion of the park, so we were determined to get her to the top-most visitor's center in the park.", "We were able to buy some souvenirs and eat a nice lunch with my wife's cousin and aunt.", 'After the long drive back, my wife, daughter, and I went white water rafting!', 'No sooner had we left the shore, my wife fell in!']
labels.14: ['Dear Diary,Well, the day has come.', 'Feels like just yesterday when I was told I was pregnant.', 'From the time I found out to this miscarriage, it was only what?']
labels.15: ['I was concerned about the number of times my mother had fallen recently.', 'I was extremely nervous to be with her and watch her walk, and I was nervous to not be there and watch her walk.', 'She fell when she was less than a foot away from me.', "I realized at that time that it didn't matter whether I was there or not, she was deteriorating and she would fall again.", 'That is exactly what happened.', 'I was actually quite relieved when the hospital suggested rehab.', 'She worked hard at rehab and was getting stronger.', 'She was never strong enough to go home, and she passed quietly in her sleep.', 'He had worked hard to keep everything just the way she liked things at her house.']
labels.16: ['About two years ago I decided to marry my girlfriend after dating for quite a long time.', 'I wanted to get her a nice ring so I contacted her cousin to find out what type of ring would suit her.', 'I ordered the ring offline and had to wait for it to be shipped and signed for.', 'Well that day fedex was in my driveway as I got home.', 'The very same day I was to propose to her!', 'The night I proposed I was very nervous and was not able to eat my food much at all which people at our table thought that in itself was very strange.', 'It was on her birthday and we decided to go to the resturant where we went on our first date at.', 'We invited my parents, our son was there, and her family.', 'We had a good time and I finally pulled out the ring to put it on my pinky so it was ready.', 'My dad was getting anxious and was ready to leave until I showed him the ring under the table.', 'So, I just simply asked, didnt get down on one knee or anything, but offered it to her and myself.', 'She said yes!', 'We were married later the next year and are very happy now.']
labels.17: ["Three months ago I discovered that I'm pregnant.", 'But the more I think about it, the more I realize that this might be a gift.', 'I keep thinking about the future.', 'I think about the baby inside me.']
labels.18: ["When I graduated with my credential and master's degree it was June.", 'This meant that I only had one job interview during that time.', 'Unfortunately, I was the runner up for that position.', 'While I continue to look for a job, I am substitute teaching.', 'It was surprising to me how bad the job market has been considering the news is constantly saying that there is a teacher shortage.', 'Now I am stuck with student loans to pay.']
labels.19: ['Today was like any other day, I was happy and in love.', 'I woke up and did my morning ritual.', 'I made coffee and breakfast for myself and my girlfriend.', 'I cooked our favorite which we, I, call egg in a hole.', 'As soon as my girlfriend, or should I say ex-girlfriend by now, entered the kitchen, something felt off.', 'I looked at her face and got a tinge of fear.', "She looked so serious when she's normally so bubbly.", 'From that moment, all time slowed down but yet everything felt like a blur.', 'First she said she needed to talk to me.', 'I panicked and she must have saw it because she tried to calm me.', 'She said that had found someone else and was no longer in love with me.', 'My heart sank.', 'I begged and pleaded with her not to leave me.', 'I was crushed and began to cry.', 'She left after eating.', "I couldn't eat and just went to my bed.", "I drifted in and out of sleep because when I slept it didn't hurt."]
labels.20: ["Me and my husband woke up one day to an email on his phone that had said 'You have been working hard this past week, I will give you a slight raise on your paycheck.'", 'When we looked at how much money we had, we had a lot of extra money.', 'We both thought that this was intentional so we decided that the next day we will plan a surprise trip to Las Vegas.', 'The next day we got there and we checked in to our room at a really nice hotel.', 'We placed our bags down and went off to the strip to go explore.', 'We went into a lot of hotels and gambled for hours.', 'Later that night we tried to gamble more but I could not find any of our money.', 'We had spent it all on gambling all day.', 'We just went back to the room and decided to go to sleep.', 'After breakfast we had five dollars to spare so we decided to just put it in a slot machine.', 'But just then we saw all the pictures lining up and we won over a thousand dollars.', 'We stayed an extra night and got some gourmet food for breakfast lunch and dinner!']
labels.21: ['About three months ago something amazing happened to me.', 'I bought my first home!', 'I received a phone call from my realtor a few days after all the showings available to me were over and she communicated to me that there was one brand new listing that we had not seen.', 'My offer was accepted and sometime later I moved in and have been loving life ever since.']
labels.22: ["Dear Diary, today I've been doing a lot of thinking about my cousin's wedding.", "Maybe that's dramatic, but I felt like I was ruining things when I spilled my champagne down the front of my bridesmaid's gown when she was counting on me to just show up and be presentable.", 'Luckily, our wonderful grandma made it to the wedding that day.', 'Leave it to an old-timer to know all the secret tricks for getting stains out.']
labels.23: ["In April my husband and I drove from Tennessee to Miami to celebrate my older sister's birthday and to see our niece and family.", 'It was a long drive and we stopped some place about 2 hours away for the night.', "We arrived right at lunchtime, but my sister and husband hadn't gotten there yet.", "So we had a little time to visit with my niece who I'll call N. We also got to meet her staff who works out of N's home.", "Once my sister (C) arrived we started to have lunch, but not before N took her mother's sandwich and hid it.", 'She made C find it in the oven which was her way of telling her mom and dad that a new grandchild was on the way.', "Later we found out that N's husband (J) was working his last day for the major department store he worked for.", "N had a dinner party that evening with all of us and J's family.", 'Sunday was a sit around the pool and finish up the Sat.', 'On Monday it was discovered that the septic system was having an issue.', 'J called someone and we all took off for a little place that sold the best cinnamon rolls I have ever had.', "Some other events were playing with some new kittens that N was caring for, watching a lot of TV geared to a 2 year old., visiting an outlet mall and having a SC low country boil dinner for my sister's birthday."]
labels.24: ["I've been dating a new guy for a few weeks, and I really wanted him to have a chance to meet her since she is so important in my life.", 'We decided to go out for dinner last week, and things could not have gone better.', 'At dinner, he was very charming and polite to her.', 'We decided to go to her house to drink some coffee.', 'When my boyfriend sat down on the couch, however, Bailey was immediately taken with him.', 'They played fetch for what felt like hours.', 'After we drank our coffee, we took Bailey on a walk in the neighborhood.']
labels.25: ["You just wake up each day and go through the same routine as though you're on auto pilot.", 'I reminded myself it was time to actually live my life and that meant having more of these happy moments so I decided to get off of auto pilot and truly live.', 'I had found  extra work in an online platform and it was nice to have extra income in times when I needed it.', 'I started to think about my job and how I had to miss out on things with my kids because of work and I decided to just quit.', 'Out of the blue, I just quit my job after 7 1/2 years and decided I was going to support myself and my children by committing to work full time online so I would be a single stay at home mom.', "I've not only been able to take my kids to school, but I've actually been able to watch my 14 year old son's soccer games and haven't missed a baseball practice for my younger son and we've spent more time hiking and going to the dog park."]
labels.26: ['My story is about a family reunion in June of this year.', 'My dad turned 90 on July 4th and he is the last  person alive on his side of the family.', 'They had three boys and one girl .', 'My dad and mom got divorced when I was sixteen.', 'He remarried a girl much younger that was my babysitter and they had one girl.', "After he married her , she stopped inviting me and my sister over   and my dad would call occasionally and say come over, but when you weren't invited over for the past few years, you don't feel that invite is sincere and I didn't go.", 'So I am not close with my half sister and we barely speak when we see each other out.', "My cousins parents from my dad's siblings never got divorced.", 'Lots of pictures were taken and everything was great.', 'I still talk to my dad when I see him in the local grocery store but it is just casual talk and that is kind of sad.']
labels.27: ['Two months ago, I went to a family reunion.', 'I had a blast meeting my family.', 'I gave my sister a big hug.', 'I played horse shoes with my cousins.', 'I won the game and celebrated my win with some cake.', 'We all got together to perform karaoke.', 'I almost fell over while singing.']
labels.28: ['My brother came to visit me last month.', 'We planned a really fun weekend with my other brother.', 'We all like beer so we decided to visit a few local breweries.', 'He arrived early and we started at a brewery near my house.', 'We started with some flights because he wanted to try everything.', 'After that, we went to another brewery not too far from there.', 'We had some more to drink and a lot of laughs.', 'After that we took an Uber to a local restaurant.', 'At the end of the day, we felt kind of tired so we decided to just hang out at my place.']
labels.29: ['I was watering the plants, vegetables, and Cacti.', 'As I watered the cacti by the chain link fence I noticed a humming bird.', 'The thing is he did not want water to drink he wanted to get wet by the mist of the garden hose.', 'I turned down the pressure of the hose to a fine mist and pointed the mist into the direction of the humming bird .', 'The bird loved it he stayed stationary in the water stream for a long time.', 'I felt great, I felt a connection with this little bird, we at this brief aquatic encounter were friends.']
labels.30: ['My daughter finally married her long-time boyfriend.', 'She needed to be on his insurance but she had just quit her job.', 'Everyone showed up in cutoffs or bathing suits and sandals or bare feet.', 'I had never seen her so happy before.', 'And I was proud to be there.', 'Honestly, the best part though was that my daughter and son reconnected.', 'He was very honored to accept.']
labels.31: ['it was during my graduation ceremony.', "Then on the day came and i called my dry-cleaner service to ask why he hasn't deliver my cloth as promised .", 'I called the assistant too.', 'I called my friend who introduced me to this company .', 'By this time ,the guy called to apologize for the inconveniences.', 'I had no option than to accept his apology even though i was furious.', 'He brought my cloth eventually and my friend came in too not long after .', 'I arrived  in time for my graduation.', 'We had after party with friends.']
labels.32: ['Four months ago, my cousin got married.', 'The most memorable moment was when I spilled champagne on my dress before the wedding.', "Thankfully, one of the girl's mom was a dry cleaner and immediately took the dress to get the stain out.", 'Their first dance was beautiful and we had fun dancing and celebrating.', 'During the toasts, everyone cried.']
labels.33: ['A few months ago around 3 I was celebrating my birthday.', 'I was having a good time that day I ended up going out to eat twice and I went shopping a few times as well.', 'I was getting things from family and friends all day.', 'I even had a taken a few shots earlier during the day.', 'I had to go to target to pick up a prescription and a few other things I needed.', 'During my time at Target I ended up running into someone I used to know.', 'after all was said and done we hugged and talked some more and eventually came to the decision that we would talk to each other again.']
labels.34: ['Four months ago, I had a wild time going to a family wedding.', "It has been the first time in a decade that we've been under the same roof.", 'I talked to mom and she said she has been doing well.', 'I talked to father and he told me he caught the biggest fish that week.', 'I talked to my sister and she has gotten a job in a big advertising firm.', 'I talked to my brother and he just graduated college with a job prospect.', 'My older brother is getting married to a rich tycoon woman.', 'At the party, I got a little too drunk.', 'I threw up on my older brother.', 'He forgave me.', 'We went home with many memories.']
labels.35: ['I ride my bike in the path around the river.', 'Suddenly, there is big noise from the sky.', 'Seven fright jets flied though the sky.']
labels.36: ['Four months ago, I had to say goodbye to three friends in my life.', 'To loose all three like that, I felt that the world was against me.', 'I cried in private and in public.', 'I moaned their deaths feeling suicidal.', "I arrived to my Uncle's memorial service grief stricken.", "The next stop was to my best friend's wake.", 'My last view of my pet dog was crushing.', 'I was sad for four months and still counting.', 'I lost myself in these losses.']
labels.37: ['I booked a trip to Rocky Mountain National Park.', 'It was a quick plane flight there but the drive to the actual park took quite a while.', 'After spending sometime there I decided to go white water rafting.', 'We headed over to the nearby town of Idaho Spring, Colorado.']
labels.38: ['Two women decided to be together for the rest of their lives on this day.', 'It was a beautiful ceremony attended by friends and family.', 'Afterward, there was a nice assortment of food served.', 'They both work hard at their jobs.']
labels.39: ['A couple months ago during summer I was playing basketball in a tournament.', 'We were doing pretty well in the tournament and had already won several game.', 'On me time I had my 2 brothers and one of my cousins playing.', 'We were all having fun and enjoying ourselves.', 'I remember it was like the 3rd or 4th game when something bad happened.', 'The other team missed a shot and someone on my team got the rebound.', 'I started running towards my basket and my teammate threw me the ball.', 'I caught it and took a couple dribbles.', 'Shortly after I caught the ball I noticed someone on the opposite team running towards me.', 'I went up for a lay up with my right hand to fake my opponent, then tried to finish with my left.', "During the shot I had to adjust my body in a weird angle in the air so that I wouldn't get my shot blocked.", 'Because of this I came down really hard on my right knee.', "I don't know if it was the angle I landed on or what but I felt a huge strain in my knee as soon as I landed.", 'I sat at the rest of the game and had to walk with a limp for the rest of the day.', 'I later on went to the doctor to check it out and found out I ruptured a ligament in my knee.', "I had to get surgery to repair it and couldn't walk again for a couple of weeks."]
labels.40: ['After trying for a year to have a baby, I finally got pregnant.', 'Then, 6 months ago, I had a miscarriage.', "I couldn't stop crying.", 'My husband was almost as broken up as I was.']
labels.41: ["Dear Diary, I am stressed out over Auntie's diagnosis.", 'Who took me by surprise was the stroke she had during treatment.']
labels.42: ['This even took place at my convocation party.', 'I had planned to wear a particular outfits for this event just to standout.But unfortunately ,my dry-cleaner almost ruined it and that would have got me upset really.', 'But i was happy at the end of the day one of my friend came trough for me by making sure the outfit made it to me at the last minute .Just when i had lose hope completely.', 'Just when we thought it was over, we planned to have some time out as buddies who just graduated.', 'we went partying at a club downtown.', 'One of us started misbehaving and convulsing.', 'And planning to take him to the hospital but he refused going .', 'We left the party and headed to his apartment some miles away from the club.', 'When we go to his apartment, He had his shower and was calm.', 'He made sure he threw-up the alcohol intake from the party.', 'Had dinner with my family.', 'I checked on my buddy from the club earlier and my friend [Daniel] told me he was okay.']
labels.43: ['About twelve weeks ago, my husband and I decided to head down to Miami.', 'I wanted to see my sister and surprise her on her birthday.', 'Seeing all of the sites along the way was a great experience.', 'When we finally arrived in Miami we immediately set out to get the surprise party worked out.', "I don't think I've ever seen my sister so surprised or happy when we all yelled Surprise and turned on the lights when she opened the door."]
labels.44: ['About 6 months ago I learned how to forage for food.', 'I had no idea that there was so much food all around us that we simply pass by every day.', 'I learned about it after I watched a video on it.', 'I did a bunch of reading and research which prepared me to go into the parks around me and find things.', 'My self-reliance and self-trust has gone up.']
labels.45: ['I was holding on to my pee and drinking more cups of water than i needed.', "I was holding on to my urine a lot for four weeks because i was didn't want to let go of the online games i was playing.", "I noticed that i couldn't control my bladder and the frequency of going to the bathroom was increasing.", 'I was scared for my life.', "If i didn't go the bathroom once my body called for, my urinary tract would start hurting.", "I went to the my annual physical doctor and she didn't know what kind of treatment i needed.", 'She referred me to someone else.', "Anyways, I thought my frequency to go to the bathroom would go away with eating fruits and vegetables, but it didn't.", 'So i have an appointment lined up next week with a urinary specialist.']
labels.46: ['I attended a friends wedding today.', 'They had so much food to choose from.']
labels.47: ['I harnessed up 11 out of the 12 dogs i had to the sled and hit the trail.', 'I had my go-pro rolling since the day was so beautiful and i wanted to capture the openness of crossing the river on such a bright day.', 'We ran without a break until we got to the river and i could tell the dogs were getting tired.', 'We took a break right before the downhill to cross the river and when i looked up i noticed a moose just across the bank.', "The dogs were so tired they didn't even notice, the more i watched this big cow moose eat off the trees i noticed a calf emerge from the woods behind her.", 'While i was watching the moose i heard a scream not too far off which sounded like a cat, and indeed it was.', 'Only 45-50 yards away from the moose was a full grown lynx walking the bank of the river.', "Just when i thought this free nature show couldn't get any better a second lynx walked out from the woods and began a mating call with the first lynx.", 'Soon as the lynx and moose were out of my site i commanded the dogs to hit the trail and continue the run.']
labels.48: ["When Auntie was diagnosed with cancer for the fourth time, it was rough, but we thought she'd beat it.", 'Then, out of the blue, she had a massive stroke which reduced her to still alive, not needing life support, but also not able to really communicate.', 'As (then) executor of her trust I began to gather everything I needed to make sure this went smoothly for my cousin (her beneficiary).', 'It was hard to post her final goodbye to friends on FB after she passed, but I did what she asked.', 'Then I discovered: she had not fully finished setting up the trust and I had very limited resources.']
labels.49: ['I recently celebrated the birthday of a family member.', 'I (and some of my family members) bought party favors, a birthday cake, and the like.', 'The most memorable part of the event was lighting the candles.', 'I remember falling asleep happy that night, having enjoyed the event.']
labels.50: ['I started raising my hand o speak as often as possible.', 'I developed a workshop.']
labels.51: ['Megan and I went to college together and lived in the same apartment complex for three years.', 'Then one night we were out with another friend at a bar together and joked about how we should just give up looking for a partner and date each other.', 'It was then that a light bulb seemed to go off in both of our heads.', 'Our other friend ended up leaving early so we just chatted all night and eventually went home together.']
labels.52: ['I was about to move from Ohio to Florida.', 'I felt stagnant in Ohio, while at the same time I was interested in a woman I had met nearly 40 years ago when we both shared out first kiss when we were both 13.', 'I had a stroke 2 years ago, and was now retired.', 'At this same time I had been talking to my first kiss when I was quite young.', 'I was shocked that she had been single for almost 12 years.', "It didn't sound like a horrible idea moving down to Daytona Beach Florida from Cleveland Ohio either.", 'I had a furnished mobile home awaiting me, the lady I was interested lived very near where I would me, and money would be plentiful for my happiness.', "But, then everything that could've gone wrong did.", 'I had 4 goodbye evenings planned to say goodbye to people I knew in Ohio.', 'Practically noone showed up at any of them.', 'I did manage to give some things to a couple friends that were very good momentos of my life.', 'And I gave, sold, or left behind all my furniture as I was just moving myself and my 2 cats down to Florida in my car.', "When I got down to Florida, I found out that I'd been scammed by the person that said they had a mobile home for me to rent.", 'THERE WAS NO FURNISHED HOME!', 'I had to stay and pay for a motel room at first (that the landlord said she would cover.)', 'After finding out about the scam, I booked myself into a cheaper (yet expensive) Airbnb while I tried to figure out where to stay.', "During all this, the woman I came down to see said she didn't want a romance, and that she just wanted a friendly platonic thing.", '(This after  talking to her for over 2 years over the phone.', "Thanks to my sister lending me the money, I have now found a mobile home that I have bought with my sister's money."]
labels.53: ['I feel that the most appropriate thing for you to do would be to call the bride and explain your situation, and offer to have them over or take them out when your situation improves.', 'As far as pressure from your parents, unless they are providing you with the money to attend and the money to give the couple, they should let it rest.', 'i had a great time in my lifetime.']
